UpAg7f0xbUqyfi2uFW32ug.text: Excellent food! The oxtails will keep you addicted, as will the guacamole! So many good things, just pick something and enjoy!  Service is terrible, even for a simple call in and pick up, Especially if you don't speak Spanish.  They used to have dancing to spanish language music on the weekends.  If they still do, it's a great time with no fighting or negative issues of any kind.

IFKp--egnMd44KFuZJ3B6A.text: I love the food here but like a lot of really good places in this area, it can get slow during lunch.  I've also heard they can get really busy at dinner time but I've only had lunch. Try the crispy shredded beef or the milanesa steak.

WD5K6G6GBois6kBhn_qA5Q.text: The waiter looked like he wanted to be elsewhere, he wasn't welcoming and seemed bored every time he had to come to our table. Not only was that putting us off but the food was cold when we got it and it was lacking flavor. Not interested in visiting again.

8kJ_dKACO2TuU92WFg41zA.text: My friends and I needed a pick me up.  My girlfriend's part Cuban, my guy friend is Puerto Rican and I'm part Ecuadorian....   This place was like "home" cooking for all of us!    Rice and beans, fried pork, plantains, guacamole, yucca, soup, Cuban sandwiches, mango and other fresh fruit  milkshakes,  flan ... REAL FRESH CREAMY FLAN... , tres leches cake .... And to top it off Cuban cafe au lait.  As for the decor... It was like stepping into my Ecuadorian family's restaurant in Quito... dark wood, high back leather chairs, deep red curtains and wrought iron accents, tiled dance floor ... and the service was just like family ... welcoming and generous to a fault.  Yup ... It's ALL that ... And did I mention the food is to die for...   One of our new favorite places for sure... And one of these nights my Mamacita is going to light up the dance floor.

BEtsaajZPMfeQzW7Rrppog.text: My daughters graduated today so I decided To take them to what was my favorite restaurant we ordered the Hemingway chicken and some stark with some black bean and rice The rice was really soggy and had no salt the bean had this horrible taste to them  Overall the service was good our waiter didn't charge us for the only our appetizers and I'm drinks  They must have change chef because the food has horrible it's a shame because the FOOD USE TO BE GOOD HERE now it's bad great service but bad food

fYH42K9ZKFCR6fFm-bsfUw.text: The food was good; however, the issue came after dinner. Our check was $59 (with a $10 tip) but our waiter ran the debit card for $82. He could not figure out how to correct the error. The manager came to the table to explain what happened. She said that the amount we filled in would be all that would run through the debit card. She lied. We had a debit from the checking account for the $59 AND the $82. When we went back to speak to the manager. She said it was up to the debit company to correct. She refused to fix it even after we demanded cash back. She said it would be applied back to the account in a month. INSANE. We would not EVER eat here again. BEWARE.

fFnxygfJYC0OhFDlolpYNQ.text: I live very close to here and decided to call in a carry out order. Ordered a Cuban sandwich which was very tasty, however I almost walked out before I got my food. It was about 630 and only about 10 people in the restaurant, I walked in and the hostess was at the front desk and gave me no attention whatsoever even when I was standing right at the desk. I remained about 10-15 minutes before the bartender finally asked me if I wanted a drink and I told him I was waiting for food, he gladly took care of me! Except for the bartender, the kind of service I received will not make me want to return any time soon. Hopefully they haven't lost too many potential customers due to this!  John B.

wKpLUcrQ-qEPPekKPwN2LA.text: Me and my friend decided to check out this spot for drinks and to listen to music. I always wanted to visit the restaurant. The lady that was performing Wanda Lopez was very good. She had people up dancing and enjoying the music. The restaurant was full. There were a few birthday parties going on that night. The highlight was seeing Coach Riveria for the Carolina Panthers there with his family and friends while we waited. There was no one to greet us when we walked in. After having to ask for the host we were told there was no tables available. So we sat the bar. I had a pina colada without alcohol. It was too sweet. The pork bites were nicely seasoned and good. I will probably visit the restaurant again.

LKlvg8aWqYckckLO6SyYwQ.text: I went to Charlotte with my family for New Years 2017. Wanted to eat and listen to Latin Music. This place had both. I didn't eat as I wasn't hungry. Family did and they seemed to have enjoyed their meals. I really enjoyed the music. It was a life band of about 4 members and these boys were jammin' ! The played Cuban and Latin Jazz tunes. They also played american classic instrumentals like "Hotel California" in Latin Jazz. Cool stuff.   The ambiance was receptive and well dressed as some hung out at the bar as they listened to the music and had a drink, while others even danced. This is a place I'd go to again !

On my visit, there were two men singing along with some kind of music machine with various tracks on it.  I only mention it because there werent live musical instruments being played, but it was okay because whatever sound system they have makes the music sound like it is live in the building.  They were great singers and even stepped out and danced at times with the customers who gathered at the front to dance.      I ordered the stewed beef with rice. It was very good. I also tried the strawberry mojito.  Im not typically a drinker, but it was very strong (to me). I don't know if that's good or bad.  Otherwise our server was nice and a couple different people stopped by our table to check if we needed anything.   Also, we had a reservation and were seated immediately.

tNdDnKT9w5D2L9ykHyxExg.text: Came here for lunch and it was around half capacity. Appetizer sampler platter was great and came out quick, but I agree with the other reviews that the service for entrees was a little on the slow side. Would not recommend coming here if you need a quick 30 minute in and out.   I had the Ropa Vieja and it was pretty good, but a little salty. It comes default with white rice, black beans, and plaintains, but you can sub them for 2 sides of your choice. Papaya shake was great and recommended. I'd probably go back, but it won't be a staple favorite.

V8nwomutYsDM_aMYxPAFyA.text: I went for my mom and sisters birthday and they were rude, and took 2 hours to get us our food. Won't be going back.

kwmUhcrzbffZEFy1W8SXsw.text: beautiful place, good food good atmosphere, I like, a excellent care what a great time with my family I recommend for its authentic Cuban food

1jR-uqd53QDUmBtUa1Ld3Q.text: Like many other reviewers, I did not have a good experience here. Service was slow and the waitress was absent-minded. We went on a Saturday, and got there early enough that it wasn't yet crowded.   But the food is what really disappointed us. My churrasco (skirt steak), came out very overcooked (I had asked for it medium-rare).  Not even a hint of pink in it. It had also been pounded with a meat tenderizer until it looked like a cube steak. I sent the steak back, and the next one came out a bit less overcooked, but still no where near medium-rare.   My husband's picadillo was even more disgusting. The meat was ground so fine it was about the texture of canned cat food. It was covered in a gloppy tomato sauce. Normally a picadillo has things in it, like peppers and olives. None of that in this version, just meat ground to an unrecognizable pulp with tomato sauce.  Both entrees came with black beans and rice. The rice was mushy and completely unseasoned. The black beans were also woefully underseasoned. We had tostones with our meals instead of the standard maduros. The tostones were overly soft and very greasy.  I agree with previous reviewer would suggest Carlos Cafe in Rock Hill. The food is always well-seasoned and cooked to perfection, and the service is great as well.

6VuDJyvMPHqcKN4zR6g0Qw.text: I tried this place on the recommendation of coworkers. I was hesitant but was in the mood for something different. I was pleasantly surprised. The food was very good, restaurant was clean and enjoyed the Cuban music playing. The only thing keeping it from 5 stars was the service. There are some good and not so good members on the waitstaff. Waiting thru most of my meal for someone to come by to see if we need anything was a bummer. Any good waiter/tress will stop by a few minutes after food is served to check on the table. I will continue to keep dining here despite the spotty service.

zOpzK7NF5hKO3YWu8mNJig.text: I've been here a couple of times for lunch, right before the holidays and again after.  Both times the service was a little spotty.  We would get seated right away but then it would take awhile for our order to be taken.  Once we ordered the food came out pretty quickly but then it would take awhile to get drink refills.  By the time we got refills we were ready for our checks which also took awhile to get.  Aside from that the food was pretty good.  I had the ropa vieja the first time which was good but didn't come with enough rice (at least for me, I like to have some rice for each bite and I ran out half way into my meal!)  I had to ask for more, which they had no problem just giving me some more.  The second time I went I tried the lechon asado which was also good.  This time I ordered the rice which had the black beans mixed in and that was a better helping than when I ordered the rice with the beans on the side...I'll definitely be back for lunch to try some of their other dishes but hopefully they can get their service a little faster.  They are very nice and helpful but just a little on the slow side!

8jwwzJl1_NHqFzDoRaV5UQ.text: WOW is what I thought when I finally found a restaurant to take my husband to that caters to the Latino. He is Puerto Rican and we have yet to find anywhere to eat since we moved here in August, 2006. We found one place - I am naming no names - but it was not authentic and we were excited to go out to this place for his birthday dinner. We got there and were seated quickly. We loved the atmosphere and thought surely the service and the food would measure up...NOT - it took forever to get our drinks, we had a party of 5 - including 3 adults - and only got 5 rolls. They don't have Cuban bread! They even only brought 3 pats of butter. It took the waiter several times to understand our order so when it was my husband's turn to order - he ordered in Spanish which the waiter still didn't seem to understand. Our food came out with the white rice cold, the tostones cold, the plantains cold - my chicken soup never came - the waiter said he thought I said I didn't want it??? My Chicken Milanesa was not supposed to have onions but I bit right into one! The tostones were soft not firm - the yellow rice was weird - not authentic and I have had plenty of arroz amarillo in my day. We asked for more bread on several occasions and it never came, nor did our refills. When we asked the last time for more bread - we were told it would take 7 minutes!!! We told the waiter of our dissatisfaction and he didn't say too much. When the check finally came - the waiter said - the owner gave you a discount and some coupons...A 10% discount off of a $55- $60 bill! The coupons were what they would give anyone - buy 1 entree and 2 drinks and get one half off! I will never go back here again! What a waste!

eQl9hVxEHEBA550FK34-Jw.text: As a native South Floridian partially raised by Cubans, I know my way around Cuban cuisine. Reading through some of the reviews, I was a bit hesitant to go to A Piece of Havana, knowing that my hopes and dreams of a walk down memory lane could easily be dashed. Suffice it to say, I'm glad my fear of disappointment didn't get in the way of my need to reminisce.  We went at kind of an off time: 3pm on Saturday and there were very few people there. We were greeted and seated right away, then the fun began. Our server was delightful, especially since she was helping me persuade my fellow dining compatriots to enjoy some adult libations with me.  Mojitos, Cuban bread, crispy shredded beef, Havana chicken, shrimp, black beans and rice, and Cuban coffee...?! You can't go wrong and I'm excited to go back.

71XOv8Iq-PJgIoP40ODnvg.text: The live band can start at any time even though the website says after 10pm.  On the Saturday we went it started at 7pm.    I personally hate loud music while I'm eating and they had a microphone on every instrument.  In a small space like their dining room you don't need to be that mic'd up.  I was deaf before we got our food and we couldn't carry a conversation with our friends.    A good band knows how to adjust their volume for the venue.  They played a weird mix of Latin and US pop songs, and Bob Marley.  I wouldn't go back just for their band unless they lowered the volume and stuck to a theme in their music.  It's not a drunk wedding crowd they're playing for...  I got the Cuban sandwich (no cheese) with fries.  It was pretty tasty but I was burping pork the following 24 hours.  We went out afterwards and I definitely did not feel like dancing!  I would go back to try another dish but only if that's the only thing we're doing all night...

If you never been, you owe it to yourself to experience A Piece of Havana!  You will fall in love with the place and the atmosphere.  We can`t get enough!! Out of this world, unique.  Lively and real.  You`ll love it!!

M4xp95ecou-DHmV79xkb0w.text: This hurts to write...my hope is that the owners read this and course correct the issues. I have been coming here since 2015. I have hosted corporate team dinners, family reunions, dinner parties - probably have dined here 25-30 times. The service was always hit or miss...but being Cuban I didn't mind...and  because food was always incredible. Not tonight. It was average at best. Our entire table commented that the food had no taste. The ropa vieja was fatty and bland. The yuca was dry and the mojo was all lime [barely any garlic]. Overall - disappointing...and we want to come back so please re-train the cooks. I asked my waiter if they had hired new cooks and he responded that they are always training new cooks so my suggestion is put some quality controls in place. We ordered a flan and when the server brought it to us the caramel/sugar around the flan was all black - clearly it was burnt and as such tasted bitter. I would have hoped that the waiter would have not served that and then took that opportunity to give the cook some feedback. I regret that I didn't provide this feedback while there - but again, my hope is the owners see this and take action. The meals I have had there in the past were some of the best Cuban food experiences I have had...and this from a Cuban who moved here from Miami. Please, please please take action!!!

JuRGquiyF9EJVPro4hxcKg.text: It's really unfortunate that I'm giving this restaurant a bad review. We've been here a couple of times and our first visit was okay. Our second visit however, was absolutely terrible. We came with a group of friends before a church event. There were eight of us in when one of our group members went in to get a seat, the restaurant told us that they did not have space for us. At the time, the restaurant was completely empty and they continued to turn us away. Eventually, my friend had to beg to be able to eat there, and they allowed it as long as we promised to leave by 8 PM.   The staff must have felt frustrated about having to serve us after claiming that they did not have space. The server was extremely rude and inattentive. She rolled her eyes several times and was extremely impatient.   Several people in the group had made an order for chicken. While our food was being made, one of the servers came out to tell us that there was no chicken of that type yet and suggested that they replace it with a different kind of chicken. We agreed and that's what they served. However once we got our check, The three of us that had ordered the chicken found that we had been upcharged for the chicken breast. This was completely unacceptable, considering that the change made in the menu was made by the restaurant. And needless to say, the meal was sub-par as it could not be prepared in its original, authentic way.   It took more than 30 minutes for us to get our meals. Overall it was such a disheartening and disappointing experience. We were there for the joy of authentic Cuban food and hospitable service, and we did not get either. To be completely honest this experience was enough to deter me from going back. I hope that The staff could be more mindful about the customers' needs.

xX2LtKR91MxuqW9AcEkY6w.text: This edition of Excited about Eating takes us to southwest Charlotte and to A Piece of Havana. Growing up in Tampa, I have had the opportunity to eat at some authentic Cuban restaurants, but since moving to North Carolina, it has been difficult finding  Cuban food. For the most part, they fall short of my expectations.  Dora here. With so few Spanish restaurants in the Charlotte area, we were surprised to find the place empty. This is what it looked like on a Sunday around 11:30, but during our meal, people started rolling in. We just tend to be earlybirds.  For an appetizer, we chose the Caribbean Calamari, breaded, deep fried and served with a dipping sauce. The calamari was plentiful, good, fried crispy, (maybe too crispy) and worked well with the dipping sauce. Dora here. Dry and brittle for me, but hubby cleaned the plate, so...  For my meal, I chose one of my favorite Cuban specialties, Fried Pork chunks slow cooked in Mojo sauce then deep fried and topped with sauteed onions. The pork chunks were great, fried perfectly and mixed well with the Mojo sauce and sauteed onions although more mojo sauce would have been great. The plantains (banana family) were firm, just as I remembered them, and the fried yuca was cut into larger pieces than I prefer.  Dora here. After living in Tampa for so long and loving Spanish food, I admit being a little disappointed upon first glimpse of the Palomilla Steak (Bistec de Palomilla). Pounded super thin and unbreaded, I could've done without the chimichurri sauce. I don't believe it added anything and actually detracted from the presentation. What do you think?   Still Dora. Service was quick and the place was spotless. If we make it back (it's a long drive), I will order something different to avoid comparing A Piece of Havana with all our favorite haunts in Florida. The meal ended on a high note.  We rate this restaurant 3.5 forks out of 5 for a family restaurant serving very good food. ~Ernie & Dora Hiers, Fiction Faith & Foodies Blog
