O8HoLDKkcnor9xRl0DD8Cg.text: Hidden gem in Charlotte. Ordered the combo plate and everything was delicious! Chimchurri sauce fresh and delicious. Great monitors.  Friendly service and good atmosphere!

woETANOzAW4hnyNPC6a-xw.text: Had lunch here and it was excellent. Everything was fresh, flavorful, and not drowned in salt. Croquetas are made fresh to order. The red bean soup was so delicious. I will definitely be coming back!

f8P5WW70IUFl1sfcUr14vQ.text: When I was feeding my car down by Carowinds Blvd, I used my new(er) BFF aka my droid phone Yelp app to locate a new place for lunch.  The truth is I've been condemned to un-cultured, un-worldly food for way too long.  I was determined to get some real taste back in my mouth before it goes on strike.  Who knows there's a cuban restaurant in the suburbs!  The location is obscure... a little strip mall off Tryon (right at Moss).  Something about Cuban/Latino music, it just brightens the day (and the place).  Ok, so the service was slow (no one sat me, but to their defense I was standing by the hostess stand looking at the menu, I think they thought I was a to-go customer).  Lunch menu (smaller portion) is only available during the week.  So I went after the sandwich (didn't feel like breaking my bank for a quick solo lunch).  Instead of the old standby Cuban sandwich, I tried the Miami Sandwich.  It's like a Cuban with with lettuce, tomato and mayo and ham croquettes.  I love croquettes.  I also orderd the soup of the day, Ajiaco Cubano.    The soup was tasty.  Though it's very brothy (not as much as stew-y as it's described during my quick research online).  It definitely wasn't creamy like the waitress said.  But nonetheless it was good.  My cup ($2.95) had a piece of fatty pork and a little yuca in it.    The sandwich ($8.95) itself was ok.  The pork was a little tough.  That's the disappointing part. (side note: best freaking Cuban sandwich EVER was the one I got in DC in the market... see my old review).  The bread was good, and the mayo/mustard added to the taste.  I definitely enjoyed the croquettes, which were being deliciously smushed by every bite I took.  The sandwich was big enough for me to save half for later.  I substituted fries with plantains maduros.  I'm a sucker for sweet plantains.  And they were good.  But is it possible to mess up sweet plantain?!  Overall it was an ok experience.  The waitress was nice, but I can see if it's busier (the place had 3 other tables at the most, virtually empty) the service would be slow.  The pork was the least impressive.  But I was happy, I was very very happy that I haven't lost my appreciation for REAL food :)

g274XKLMOjp8HCzPC7hf-w.text: Hit and miss, depending on how busy they are.  Sometimes they bring out bread, sometimes they don't.  The "mariquitas" appetizer is good; the "Havana sampler", not so much.  The vaca frita (crispy shredded beef) is good; the "fried pork chunks", not so much.  We've made reservations several times: sometimes they'll seat us right away, sometimes they'll try to put us at a two-seat table right in the middle of the dancefloor and the greeter will argue with us when we tell her we reserved a booth.  The live music on Friday nights can be pretty loud, if you want to have a conversation.

P8iGsegDZ1MSfVyOSxLvwg.text: OK for vegetarians as we have to survive off the side dishes. Great for non-veg folks, lot of options.

9gnZHaE29kN_4ILZPaG2Kw.text: Loved the food. Great location. Family place. BUT service is hit and miss. Week day lunch took 90 minutes, and made me late for work. Coupons keep it inexpensive.

jeSJkQDpv-HFHTuDQjTVtg.text: I wanted to have great experience here. Came with my husband for a date night with a reservation. We were 10 min early and seated right away. But experienced long wait time just see a waitress and order drinks. The food was was ok but what really upset us is that after we got our food we did not see a waitress until we had to ask for to give us our checks! This was a hour wait. This was very frustrating being that it's a nice place with live music. I hope they get this together.

_u9y7z8cDiLUN2pyHQVjUw.text: I've never been to a Cuban restaurant before today. Having been exposed to Cuban culture through my wife's family, I have only tasted some homemade Cuban food.  My wife and I ate pork and beef empanadas to start with. Pork is the best. We then ordered skirt steak / black beans and rice and the cubed pork /black beans and rice. We were totally impressed with the food. The service was excellent and the waiter patiently explained what we didn't know about the food we were ordering. I finished with Cuban coffee. I never tasted Cuban coffee before. I had two cups! The only negative was the iced tea. It was very weak and I could have read a newspaper through it. Totally great experience ! We will be back !

-ug26SNOBi9G46tnkIR60g.text: We happened upon this place when the hubs was code orange, and the slow start (only one server for the whole restaurant on a Monday) left me nervous we were going to have to bail. However, once we were finally seated and our order was taken, the food was ultra fast. Our server asked if we were familiar with Cuban food, and well, I've never been there, so no. We ordered the roasted pork and grilled fish (mahi mahi). The roasted pork was good, the fish was OK but I'd order something different next time.  The plantains were (of course) delicioso, and I wished we had tried some of their really yummy looking mojitos (like 18 flavors) or sangria.    But the whole point of this review is that FINALLY after waiting my whole life (OK so the 14 years I've been in the QC), I found worthy empanadas!! The server said the ham & cheese was his favorite but I went for the beef.  The pastry covering was nice and crispy, but not greasy at all and the beef was seasoned perfectly and also was not greasy at all!  Hallelujah!! Hail to the empanada maker!  Even though I live nowhere near Steele Creek/Ayrsley I would make an excuse to come back and have a meal of mojitos, empanadas, perhaps some of their avocado dip special and tres leches. Bueno!  Tip: coupon in Citipass made it even more reasonably priced.

BM87PpObWrJRWa0aUJzzMQ.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants and the price is very reasonable. Start with a Calle Ocho Mojito. They grind mint leaves into it and use cane sugar.   I typically get the chicken empanadas and the shrimp in garlic sauce. The shrimp includes either yellow rice or plantains. I like to double up on the plantains. For dessert, I get the coconut flan and two cuban coffees. Awesome! The food is great. The service is good.  There is live music on Friday and Saturday nights.  It can be a bit loud.  If that is an issue for you, there is outdoor seating.

7NF4kJ3mBWhgKOoydwbaCA.text: The place is nice. I had "Vaca Frita" it was OK but it tasted more like "chimichuri" than Vaca Frita. They have traditional Cuban sodas like they have back in my home town of Miami. But being from Miami I am spoiled when it comes to Cuban food and am very selective. The "mariquitas" (fried plantain chips) were a bit soggy and had too much salt on them. The server was nice but it seemed like it was a Cuban restaurant trying to give the appearance of a Mexican one to gain money from "anglo locals" that assume anything "Latin" = Mexican. I would go back on Friday Nights when there is a salsa and the Cuban community really comes out.  Overall I liked it.

4tl13P55MK-OoZPKr7Bn6Q.text: Great restaurant...I read some great reviews on Yelp and knew I had to try this place. I was impressed with the service and the food was perfect. They also have live music and a nice little dance floor to get your salsa on. Great place you won't be disappointed!

D8t87_-xTwDTHcJDooJ-1Q.text: So good and the staff is so sweet! Between 4 of us we got white rice, beans and rice, and yellow rice (all delicious), fried yuca, green beans, and yummy plantains for sides!   Roasted pork, Cuban skirt steak, crispy shredded beef, and Hemingway chicken! All so good! The owner ended up giving us a gift when we left because we asked questions and complimented the food! I definitely recommend this place! Great environment as well! Clean and inviting! Next time we are in town I want to come back!

vDZV4eV0I6YgvOm96RkxiA.text: I love this place!! The oxtails are really good and meaty...the service is really slow..

9RcdKEosEoqUrj8s82DarQ.text: The restaurant is decorated quite nicely, though the silverware wrapped in paper napkins took away from the custom made leather chairs. There was a guitar player doing the usual Spanish guitar numbers. There were eight tables seated and two waiters, which may explain why it took 20 minutes to take my order. My waiter was nice and attentive once he came over. Two of the eight tables were speaking Spanish, which could be a good sign that ethnic locals frequent this place.  I had the Original Mojito, Cuban Salad, Pork Chunks with Congri and Plantains. The mojitos here are all made from scratch. My mojito was made right away and was very good. The Cuban Salad came out in about five minutes, and the meal came out a few minutes later. The salad was just as it appears in pictures posted to Yelp. The ingredients were fresh and tasty. The pork chunks were properly marinated and cooked, and were really good. The congri and the plantains were as I expected, which is to say good and authentic.  I ordered the Tres Leches for dessert. While it was ok, it certainly was not authentic. Instead of the real thing, this was a slice of pound cake soaked in condensed/evaporated milk with whipped cream topping covered with a squirt of dulce de leche.  Overall, the food and drinks were great, dessert was ok, and service was ok.

XgZ7HdqHBLFw7kyrBBgjJQ.text: Simply an excellent place for Cuban cuisine! All the food was flavorful and tasty. Only complaint is that the service is SLOW! I know it's crowded, but to me, that means you need better planning to stay in this business.  But, the food was worth the wait. Just be prepared to tough it out, especially during the weekends.

31-mbu6RRjn1JSloGZ1vcA.text: It's rare I come across a place that gets everything right. There's almost always something I'd do differently if I owned the business. But A Piece of Havana is the sort of place where I'd really have to be stretching to find any reasonable criticism.  In the 10-15 times I've been here I've tried several different appetizers, entrees, desserts and cocktails and not once has anything failed to impress. As far as I'm concerned, there are really only a few things a Cuban place has to get right: Cuban sandwich, mojito, ropa vieja, flan and cortadito. And finally, some effort has to be made with the decor and music to make the diner forget for a moment that he/she is actually still in Charlotte, NC.   In every one of these and many more, A Piece of Havana surpasses expectation. Something as simple as their black beans are the best black beans I've ever had. The flan is also the best I've had, at least outside of the Spanish speaking world.   Perhaps most impressive, the Cuban sandwich is as good as you're going to get outside of south Florida. I grew up taking family vacations to the Tampa Bay area to visit family. And until I found this place I'd given up on finding a proper Cuban sandwich in Charlotte. I don't know where they get their bread or if they bake it themselves, but it makes the sandwich. Everywhere else, to their eternal shame, seems to substitute French bread.

J_0pmCAjeQFyBJNXeeaNOg.text: This was the second time we had lunch in this joint.  First time I had the crispy shredded beef and the woman had a Cuban sandwich.  Both were pretty good along with some tostones and plantains.   Crispy beef was a bit oily but I ate every bite of it.  This time I had the garlic shrimp and tostones and boiled yucca and the gal had some skirt steak with rice and beans and a couple plantains again.  Skirt steak was ordered well done and was a little chewy which is expected cooked well but did taste good.  The garlic shrimp was decent some where cooked better than others, I like my shrimp cooked longer, more well done, a couple were that way and a few were softer, not as good.  Yucca was perfectly cooked and tostones,  well, it's hard to mess up a tostones,  so it was good as well.  Service was good, waiter was very attentive,  didn't have to look for him for anything.   Food was out in good time, place was busy for a lunch crowd.  I will have to try it one night for dinner, looks like the drinks are worth trying as well. Adios for now.

9SgJawnEkVSfrZRAzBor8g.text: Very nice interior, welcoming and friendly staff, and a solid Cubano sandwich make this place a must try.  The prices are extremely reasonable for a night out with the family.  I have been living in the Charlotte area for 4 years now and don't think I have had better service and friendliness from any other area restaurant.  You just can't go wrong by grabbing your next lunch or dinner here.  I have also been with large groups and they are very accommodating and keep the drinks full!

915xTIPUVKUK_olG_fB7jQ.text: I had mouth already to eat some cuban food.  Then instead I got served really bad greasy Mexican food.  Yuck couldn't even eat half of it.  Charlotte is in such desperate need of a good cuban restaurant! At least I can get a decent Cuban sandwich from Publix.

DHAUU3naydhyod3S1iI3Pw.text: I went last Saturday. All the reviews said service was slow so I expected slow. To my surprise service was great. They were full capacity and service and food great. The best of our table was the ribs OMG EVER BODY said the same thing FANTASTIC. I hade the steak which was great. The chimichuri Sauce  great. I will be back a great find. Yucha fried yummy. The appetizer platter was a not miss

nG-0sTCHKVqOFsww4qkPaQ.text: This was a great spot. Even better experience. My wife & I loved it. Food was awesome.

sTNCSyF9v4KyFIGBmXtv9Q.text: I will start out by saying my husband and I eat out quite a bit so we are seasoned restauranteurs.   My husband and I tried this restaurant previously and were not impressed with the service. The food at that time  was good but very slow service. We thought that maybe the busyness of Mother's Day had contributed to the slow service. Well after our most recent visit, it is quite apparent that they just give slow service. Most restaurants give bread that you can munch on while your food is being prepped but not this one. You have to order it like an appetizer to get any. The food is standard but not exceptional. Our reason for going to a restaurant is to eat and not to socialize. For others gathering here as a group function with no rush to get done with their meals, this place would probably be fine. Couldn't help but wonder how the lunch crowd get serviced during the week when their lunch time is limited... Not sure if we'll be back. There are other restaurants that consider the needs of their customers that we'll revisit before Havana.

PTuYcv8N0ZcwHj_XiupMmw.text: The food is authentic and tasty. BUT, the music last night was so loud that it diminished the enjoyment of an otherwise delicious meal. We told the waitress, who was lovely, but nothing changed. I will not go back because of it. Too bad,,,,

wL5dxE0elPePKN4iTBYNaQ.text: Warning.  I'm a highly opinionated half Cuban about my...errr....cuban food.   So unto A piece of Havana.  This is the first place (Out of Puerto Rico or Miami) that serves authentic Cuban food.    Want to know if you're in a real Cuban Restaurant?  Ask for a Materva.  If they don't have any, calmly proceed to the door.  Guess what, A  Piece of Havana keeps them ice cold.  Friday night is great here.  The Jazz band plays great Latin music, and creates a great ambiance.  The food:  My favorites are the Ropa Vieja, and the Parrillada Cubana will give you a a huge selection of food (steak, pork, and chicken), plus rice beans and sweet plantains.    Next time I go there, I plan to order the Sea Food Paella.  It looked insane.    I would eat here every week if it was closer to my house.  Have I said enough?  Go get your Cuban on!

dJXdKqlGhya65CLNV7ZizA.text: My girlfriend and I stopped in one day since I've always wanted to try the place and pass it all the time on the way to Club Fitness. We ordered some sangria and Havana Sampler to start. The sangria, turnover and plantains were delicious. The fried pork chunks, meat balls, and fried yuca were very bland and overcooked/dry. We also got the roasted chicken which is supposedly a house specialty. The portion was huge but the sides and chicken itself were again bland and overcooked.   OVerall, this would have gotten the place at least a "meh" and two stars. However, the service was absolutely terrible. I never like it when servers interrupt you during a meal and ask how it's going while you're still chewing on a large forkfull but at Piece of Havana I had to get up and ask for an extra silverware despite trying to flag down a waiter making his rounds. I then had to wait abnormal lengths of time to get a water refill. At that time I also requested a sangria refill but by the time it came out we were already done with our meal! I then had to get up again and go to the hostess station to ask for my check! Very inattentive service led us to not even order the tres leches dessert which I've heard is fantastic. This is too bad since I won't be back.

HjPNB32f_KkKuAg9ldfJYg.text: Food was great but service was slow and horrible. Mojitos were eh. Ox tails were very good. Service was entirely too slow for them not to be busy.

RrrRdFKI25G7juV40RPvzw.text: The best lunch value around.  The crispy beef is awesome.  They make everything fresh and the food is very good.  Dinner portions are enough to share.

h7p7j1ZzesSscwF7Zm7qqQ.text: Ok...Stop into this restaurant for lunch...My husband and I love cuban food and thought we would give it a try.  Surprisingly it was very delicious..  Service was quick and steaming hot.  However, we stop in today (Sunday evening) for dinner and service was not so good...  First, for a Sunday evening (6:30p) customers were few at hand. (maybe 8)..so we had hoped service would be quick and attentive...NOT!!  On the contrary, service was very slow... Secondly..We waited at least 30 minutes to be served. (remember almost empty restaurant) Thirdly, and most disappointing, was the food...Unlike the lunch service, the food was luke warm....Important ingredient (Mojo sauce) left out of recipe....Rice, cold...Plantains, burned.  Smh!!  Not acceptable.... If you plan on visiting this restaurant....Make sure it's LUNCH TIME!!  Because the food is really good...

zRuy0WwxFkZbNEa4gHYKew.text: This place is amazing. We found it on our honeymoon in 2012, and came back recently. The food was just as good and the service was excellent. The Cuban coffee is wonderful.

-qpQD-y6f2vhMEYcqssmsQ.text: Churasco steak was tough and full of pellejos. Bistec empanizado had parts of the steak raw. Frijoles negros sucked. In other words not a very good experience

EmKN8D7sT2y3cRumN37FcA.text: Friday night live music deserves 5 stars alone!! It's amazing! The band is incredible and will make you want to dance. The food is average. Not the best but the ambience and music makes up for it!

tZV3ohggRB5GPIfKJtIy6Q.text: This is authentic Cuban! We were thrilled to find this place. The tastes took us right back to our childhood kitchen in Miami where our abuela cooked.  The croquetas came out piping hot. The to stones were great. I had the masitas de puerco and they were great too. I asked for lime just because that was how we ate them growing up, with lots of lime. The boiled yuca was good, could have used a bit more mojo. My kids had a pan con bistec. It was the thin steak cooked just as it should, i am just not sure it was on real cuban bread. It comes with mayo and mustard so we opted to have it without. They ate it all though and really liked it. The Cuban coffee (espresso) was very authentic, the way they make it on calle ocho. We look forward to returning. So glad to find this place!

s1bkMGdderKS9EQ57695UQ.text: You want legit Cuban food? Come here. - from a cuban It might take some time to seat you but the food it worth the wait. Abuela's home cooking in Charlotte. Will definitely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Was a tres leches...so good!
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Palomilla
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sampler

0xfzNSpvDeclN4EvdEqhWA.text: I visited this treasure for the first time last night. I Googled best Mojitos in Charlotte and " A Piece of Havana " popped up. I was there  celebrating my 45th Birthday. Several other parties were going on at the same time as mine so it was on fire.. First off  the drinks are great! Nothing watered down at this place. I think they have over 15 mojitos. I ordered the skirt steak, green beans and rice. The steak and beans were seasoned to perfection the rice was good as well. They have live music and a small dance floor. I was very impressed. We will definitely keep coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. One of many parties last night. It&#39;s the perfect ladies night out spot.
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

1MlZFb4dzRnpitekgsDaiQ.text: I have frequented this dining establishment several times and have experienced the same service, rude and unprofessional. My first encounter was when we got to the restaurant approximately 1-hour before they were closing to be turned away because the "kitchen was closed". Good luck talking to the hostess, she is extremely rude and unprofessional. The second experience was just last night where my friend and I went there to listen to music and eat dinner to only be confronted by the same rude hostess stating that they only take reservations and there are no tables. It makes absolutely zero sense to me why a restaurant would only accept 100% reservations and turn away every walk-in customer.  Anyways, we got a table after speaking to the Manager. The food was good, the experience not so much. Do not go here if you want to dine comfortably and then dance. They have rules which are pretty standard for actual 'clubs'. I was asked to leave because I was wearing shorts. If management is going to be strict about their "Friday Night" dress code, then they should have the same rule for dining or state the time the 'rule' goes into effect. From what I gather, most people who dine late tend to stay and listen to the DJ and dance, so again, if they want to be strict about their "Friday Night" dress code they should impose the same rule for dining AT ALL TIMES or state the actual time their 'rule' goes into effect (you're welcome).  I find their attempt to be a 'club' ambitious but their attempt is lackluster due to the poor management, including the rude and unprofessional hostess and waitstaff.

6shjVModHaH4eVBuxiNMFA.text: Decided to get here to pick up dinner for the evening. I sat at the bar for about 20 min before I had to ask was someone working the bar area. After the person said they were coming it still took about 15-20 minutes. I ordered my food and a glass of wine and waited. During my time waiting I noticed how other guess were engaged and remembered the lack of attention I received. I felt if I spoke Spanish then my experience would have been different. I was not offered a refill of my wine glass or just coming over to Check and see how I was doing. It took some time to get my order but I just left the payment and left. I expected more interaction but I didn't receive it. The food was ok but after the experience  I received I think my expectations were reduced. I had higher hopes but maybe next time if I decide to go.

J1BO7E3QCCdzQ7CSlN_uEg.text: We came here last night to celebrate my aunt's birthday. We were greeted by Arnaldo, a friendly waiter who tended to our needs throughout the night. We were a party of approximately 20 people so our service was a little slower than it would for a smaller party. Going to dinner with a large party, a longer wait is to be expected so it wasn't a big deal. I ordered the mango mimosa and it was quite tasty!! For dinner, I had the shrimp with garlic sauce and chose yellow rice with veggies and Cuban toast as my sides. The shrimp was DELISH!! The yellow rice with veggies was a little on the salty side but I ate it all so I suppose it wasn't entirely TOO salty, lol! My husband ordered the Cuban sandwich and it tasted excellent! It was my first Cuban sandwich and I'm not a huge pork eater but ended up eating the second half of his sandwich for lunch today! The prices are reasonable but my cousin ordered a strawberry/mango margarita and it tasted too sweet and syrupy. I would recommend you try the mimosas!! Everyone was pleased with theirs! The restaurant itself is clean and the bathroom was nice!   It was also a plus that Arnaldo was willing to hold my aunt's birthday cake in the cooler until it was ready to be cut. Little things like that make for a more memorable experience. I will be going back with my husband so we can try other dishes and have a few mimosas!!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp in garlic sauce, yellow rice with veggies, and Cuban toast. I enjoyed it!!

yHfWaAUE2GdfURaxFE2zSQ.text: This is the best Cuban food my husband and I have found north of Miami (we lived there for a number of years and moved up to the Carolinas about 8 years ago). Delicious mojitos and caipirinhas, the best yuca I've ever had (the recipe changes daily so you probably won't get the same one twice). The place is always packed so reservations are highly encouraged. Seriously go, you'll thank me!

XgHg9RP7F-rv0ZUxrfg0NQ.text: Stumbled across this place tonight. Being new to the area and craving Hispanic food I decided to give it a try. The wait was about 30 minutes, but it was worth it. They had a live performer singing. My food was so delicious with large portions. Def will come again

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

qQNS3jlyeQ2vzG8QjaCcoA.text: My sister had recommended this place bc she said it was like one of her favorite restaurants in Miami. She was so dead on. We were seated in the back & they were setting up a band that started playing. We ordered the ceviche & short ribs for an appetizer& mojitos to drink. Everything was amazing & despite the restaurant being so busy food came out fast. Our waiter was great. I got the marinaded pork plate w fresh green beans & yuca. The rest of the table ordered the crispy steak & paella. If you like paella is so worth the price, so much seafood& plenty for 2 or 3 people.

Fnw86-QE3i1KU3dBta_KFQ.text: Quiet place for a quick lunch. Nice, low music, service was great, had the Cuban sandwich with the green hot chili sauce, absolutely amazing & tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

kMOyOKvHPfFOYDqaltheOA.text: This piece of Havana is a piece of ... no pun intended. At first the hostess which turned out to be our waitress acknowledge us but never sat us down. However, the customers who walked in behind us, she acknowledged them and sat them down first, I'm guessing they were regular customers...? This was the beginning of a bad experience. My daughter was anxious to try the jupina drink, however our waitress said they ran out. She offered another drink similar to jupina, which was fine. There was 8 of us. She took forever to make 2 shakes, a coffee, a mojito and a water. Two members of our party came shortly after and they ordered another shake and water. We were starving and ready to put in our order, but somehow she insisted to make the shake and water that took another 10 mins first before taking our order. She finally took our order only to come back telling us they had only 5 empanadas left (our table ordered 7). She asked if my son wanted something else in place of the empanadas and he settled on white rice and beans. Two customers walked in after us and was able to get 2 cans of the jupina drink and so I asked our waitress why, especially when they came and sat down after us. She explained they had ordered their drinks before we did. All the other tables that came after us got their food and drinks way before we did. The food comes out 30 mins later, cold, and my son had what was rice and beans mixed together. I asked him if he was ok with it and the waitress heard me and said that they were out of white rice, never informing me about it. The place was so cold, we asked if she could lower the fan above us and she apologized and said that it was hot in the restaurant and everyone was hot. When we got the bill, I saw there was a charge of 7 empanadas and pointed it out to our waitress and she reminded us that the rice and beans were about the same price and in place of the empanadas. On the receipt there was a 3 % charge on paying with a credit card. Puzzled by this, I asked our waitress and she tells us that there was a notice posted at the entrance door about this charge. She rings up my bill and 10 mins later, hands me a receipt telling me she overcharged my card with the wrong amount, voided it, and recharges it with the correct amount, all this while it seems she was teaching her what seem to be 10 year old son on how to ring up and use the credit card machine. She never gave me the voided receipt, only the corrected receipt. Never have I experienced such bad service. Slow, deceitful, uninformative and careless service.

79HLXUlss2V35lSMiKkd_g.text: My husband and I came here twice. I want to talk about the second time.  We went on a Valentine's Day, and I had to go up to the bar to get my water refilled, since the waitress didn't refill it. The bartender just laughed at me as he refilled my glass. The hell? Who laughs at customers who need something? My husband noted that his meat was incredibly dry, and I had specifically asked for my order to be cooked a certain way, and brought it up with the waitress. This girl had a pretty huffy attitude, didn't even apologize and at one point even uttered an incredibly sarcastic, "Awwww, really?" Rude, rude, rude. Normally we get a flan when we go to a Cuban restaurant, but we didn't stick around for dessert this time, since we were pretty appalled by the service and the horrible quality of the food.  I would have hoped things have gotten better since our last visit, but from the looks of some of these reviews, they haven't. Piece of Havana? More like Piece of Shit!

6phTaJK99b61WrfZUpTDQw.text: Have been here a couple of times for lunch and it's a great spot for that! Food comes out quickly even when they're busy but great quality!  Love the plantains!

dF0kxS9F5YPBeWJ6-jKGQQ.text: Fantastic food.  Definitely a must for me from now on visiting Charlotte.  Very chill & tons of flavor.

BJuclZZloHleAFqt71ShSA.text: I want to rate this higher but sadly, this restaurant has disappointed me every time. Mostly in regards to service which is what Cuban restaurants are exeptional at in South Florida from my experience. The first time I visited I was told I needed a reservation even though restaurant was practically empty. We sat next door and while the waiter was nice, the food took over 45 minutes and then I get a notice that they ran out of white rice. How does a Cuban restaurant run out of white rice...with a practically empty restaurant next door?! The second time I visited they didn't have avocado, the black beans tasted burnt, and the service was far slower. I gave them a third try during the World Cup breakfast hours they promoted and everyone's order was wrong and the food that did come out (many orders didn't) took over an hour and a half. That is three strikes, so I have given up on this place being the Cuban food gem Charlotte so desperately needs.

gMzW44LZ_eFO7JOYWAl2uw.text: Entertainment was very good. I enjoyed the live bad and a little bit of dancing. The chicken meal I ordered was a bit bland. I feel like Cuban food should have more flavors, some more adobo or something! Mojito was packed with mint leaves. There were more mint leaves than the liquid. It kept getting in my straw and I had to constantly keep spitting it out. May come back for entertainment and perhaps a different drink.

SIhOSG1jYysJVs_7L2i46A.text: I have been to Cuba and their dishes are the best I've had outside of the country. The wait staff is very polite and they regularly have live entertainment on the weekends.

l5jM8d5OPSQ1xgDwCVue6A.text: FIRST OFF, I AM CUBAN. How does one ruin a Miami Cuban  Sandwich?? It can be done. The bread was so hard I could barely chew it and had to discard part of it. I took half the sandwich home to give to the dog. The roast beef on the sandwich was tasteless, very small amount of ham, and the Swiss cheese was there, but heated away outside of the sandwich by their sandwich press. So much mayo it dripped out when trying to bite the hard bread. I NEVER had nor put mayo on any Cuban sandwich I made or got in Miami. I didn't taste any pickles on it, either. I would have sent the sandwich back but I was with my son. I won't go back. I can cook my own Cuban sandwich much better. It's a nice place, the employees, are very professional & friendly.

TLysB0PY6DT2iVpVG9wbug.text: This is being generous. The meat was over cooked, the plantain was under cooked, the rice tasted like it came from a package, and the service was atrocious.

7Pyes7iPI4v5bjfd_qjLTQ.text: Returning to A Piece of Havana to meet a friend for dinner, still an outstanding restaurant.  I opted for one of their skirt steak dinners, which arrived accompanied by a few plantains and two scoops of very tasty rice. Not a huge meal, but a decent portion. The steak was cooked perfectly, though the steak knife was appreciated. It was melt-in-your-mouth though not cut-with-a-fork. Great flavor with some spices but also the taste of the grill.  Service is excellent at keeping drinks refilled, clearing dirty dishes and generally staying on top of things without being annoying.  As we were leaving, the live music was getting set up. I understand that they also do some salsa dancing here. This place would be a perfect date night.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. A Piece of Havana in Charlotte
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Skirt steak with plantains and yellow rice at A Piece of Havana

HeQoY1EN1LVxzuGbO6PnZw.text: Authentic cuban. Good sandwiches and pork dishes. Food should have been much hotter as it was room temp. Flavor was on point. Service was slow but friendly. Very rude hostess told us we couldn't stay ( there was about 8 or 9 empty tables too ) and that was super annoying as we spent a lot of money and even ordered food to take home. Live music was terrific.

Kx28H5y4OL6fYrTHqaZTJQ.text: Coming from NJ where Cuban restaurants are aplenty, my expectations of quality authentic Cuban food are high. I am pleasantly surprised to find this restaurant meets my expectations. The food was delicious and the atmosphere supported the authenticity of the food. I am looking forward to becoming a regular.

CfvhpcwAcQOOqZLgxkLraw.text: Excellent !!! Cute restaurant, good service and delicious food !! We do not drink alcohol and they are the first restaurant that I have been to that offers virgin mojitos they make from scratch!! Thank you

izsfZALvdS4AgreMHckaWw.text: This is another place where I've been to a few times but have just gotten around to writing my first review.  First off, the service is great.  The servers are friendly and always willing to explain the menu if you have questions.   For lunch, it gets a bit busy even when it's not full.  It's more of a sit down, and you may have to wait a bit.  But, things may have gotten better because dinnertime seemed to be almost quicker.  Maybe an extra chef?  Who knows. The food itself is great.  The lunch specials are good deals, but even the dinners are reasonably priced.  You can substitute sides, but I usually go with yellow rice and black beans.  The maduros are good and not too sweet.  I had the gaunabana shake which was a bit different.  Probably won't get it again, but it wasn't terrible. I'd definitely recommend this place to people who want something different, but it's a bit heavy so don't go if you are looking for something light.

armnB4yzOzjPLuzMBUnawQ.text: This place is GOOD! It's out in the middle of no where but well worth the drive. Everthing that we ordered was spot on.  I felt the dinner portions were small for the prices but the taste and quality of the food is well worth it.

qI8_BtcCg6XBkSnEN9Mpog.text: Delicious! The palamillo steak, roasted pork, black beans, and plantains were amazing. One of the best mojitos I've ever had. There was a large celebration that took up half the restaurant and the food and service was still excellent. We can't wait to go back.

4-wMnST45x4bv_yLHSkaZw.text: The family and I had a wonderful time this past weekend. We had a reservation Friday night, we were looking forward to the food and the music . I live about 40 minutes away but the drive was soo worth it. I had the Skirt steak with yellow rice and green beans with a side of fried yucca with mojo, there was no disappointment there, it was great everything was cooked perfectly and well seasoned. To finish off we all wanted to have the tres leches and of course their Cuban coffee. I will definitely be making the trip more often.

yP8zN-vRMjKaJAopnbzlTQ.text: Pleasantly surprised and delighted with my meal.  Went during lunch.  Service was prompt and food came out fast.  Food was very flavorful, reminded me of some of the Cuban food I had in Miami.  The Mojitos were absolutely delish.  I suggest the Mango because it was made with real fruit.  The ones without fruit(peach for instance was peach flavored syrup) were still good and had the basics (lemon, mint) but didn't taste as authentic to me( though very good).  I would go definitely go again if I'm on that side of town.

JgkggkBtzo2DEsOkCHlOHw.text: My wife decided to try this restaurant the other night as we are avid foodies and love trying different cuisines. We have been to other Cuban restaurants before but not with the same atmosphere and flair as Taste of Havana. After a tasty Mojito, we started out with the calamari appetizer. It was very tender and seasoned well. We both agreed the sauce was so good, you almost wanted to eat it as a soup. For entrees. she had the fried pork chunks and I had the fried shredded beef. Both were equally delicious (we tried each other's entree). For desert, we both had the tres leches and Cuban coffee. A perfect compliment. There was also a live band which added to the ambiance. I was very pleased with the check as well. Drinks, appetizer, entrees, desert and coffee all for around $60.00 bucks including tip. We will definitely be coming back and bringing friends.

vqRDdRdix-oaJqgBI7Q7-Q.text: I was recommended to this place by a Costa Rican friend of mine.  It did not disappoint!! My husband and I came here for dinner on a weeknight to celebrate our anniversary and LOVED it.  The Long Island Lemonade was a tasty drink to start off the night.  We got the sampler platter, and the empanadas were BY FAR the best I've ever had.  Fried plantains were perfect.  Our seafood paella was to die for.  Capped the evening off with a cuban coffee, and boy did that ever give us a jolt!  But, it hit the spot.  The tiramisu was great for a Cuban place (thought it was an Italian specialty).  Our server was so very kind and attentive.  I loved it!  Will definitely be coming back!

xfmm31uMeTRZy_KImwHGGA.text: Athentic Cuban restaurant. The "congri" and the "vaca frita" were excellent.  Good food all around. Good live music and good mojitos. It's hard to find good Cuban food outside Miami, this place was really a piece of Cuba in North Carolina. I will return and highly recommend this place.

H__pujf5RJN2oyjJvuujVA.text: If your wanting to hear live cuban music, And taste it too you have to come to come to POH!! and don't forget to try a mojito or yummy sangria YOU WILL FALL IN LOVE!!

ubJTjAih2sJIIhl9dDwxHQ.text: First of all there was great atmosphere.  Live music was playing on the Friday evening that we dined.  There was also nothing to complain about the service, however, more importantly the food was very good.  Not only were the portions plentiful, but as someone familiar with Cuban cuisine, I can honestly say that everything here is authentic.  In our party we had a little of everything.  To start the Havana platter had a nice selection.  The empanadas were especially good.  The congri and roasted pork was a favorite.  We will definitely visit again.

pzTBkzuOH_sB2eD1sdxx-w.text: We walked in without a reservation, we were told they did not have any tables available but we were welcome to sit at the bar. We did, the bartender was great. The food was fantastic. We live in TN and we are trying to think of reasons to go back to Charlotte

VMHix9plK17zZsLZaaRYkg.text: Growing up in Tampa, Florida I consider myself an amateur Cuban food foodie..... I lived on shredded mojo pork, rice and beans, plantains, ropa vieja, Cuban toast, and other Cuban specialties and I know good food....... So when another Yelper Elite and I decided to scope out a new place in another part of Charlotte.  Going back to my roots, we ended up at A Piece of Havana.  I ordered the shredded pork with white beans and rice along with a side of plantains.  She ordered the crispy shredded beef with yellow rice and plantains.  Mine came correctly and hers came with yellow rice and black beans but no plantains.  It was corrected by the server promptly after I sampled mine and determined that they were too nice to pass up! So the pork was melt-in-your mouth tender with delicious mojo seasoning..... The rice and beans were tasty but the plantains were carmelized perfectly and complimented the dish amazingly.  I WILL be back to try the Cuban sandwich! A must try in Steele Creek!

3e5r9DJaTJmRAdWV6pwzAA.text: Been here a few times and have yet to write a review well here it is... the food is delicious and the sangria superb... Enjoyed dinner tonight and each and every time I go here I enjoy the food, drinks and cozy atmosphere...oh I almost forgot on Saturday nights the live music is really nice.

ssfsfempx6KIASTUpY7PEA.text: Try the chicken and fried beef, this place is your traditional Cuban joint and one of the few that is really good in this area. Be prepared to wait a little while, but that is usually standard at most authentic Cuban places. You will not leave hungry.  They have a live band on weekends.

R-quxYyUPqjfx8I3aMXiCQ.text: After hearing several co-workers brag on this place I had to check it out, I love Cuban food. The two of us got there at 7pm on a Monday night, were seated right away, there was 4 other tables with guests inside and 2 outside. Some were just having drinks. There were 2 servers, 1 bartender and 1 cook from what I could tell. We ordered within 10 minutes and we had the Starter Family meal that has a combination which is perfect for introducing someone new to Cuban food like my guest. We had , shredded Pork, Grilled Chiken and specialty thinly sliced, pounded sirloin. We also had Plantains, white rice and black beans.  We had to wait about 30 minutes after we ordered which seemed long given the low crowd in the restaurant. When the food came it smelled great but was luke warm and it almost seemed like they had forgotten about us given the time and temp ? I did not send the food back (which is rare for me) because it was all together. Despite the coolness, the food still tasted great. Full of Cuban flavors and in the end I was content. My guest also enjoyed the food but expected a little more. Over all I will recommend them but just plan on a long wait and be sure to get it at the right temp and you'll be satisfied.

aSKVjqzKl38sFLPoDr9JAQ.text: Went on 8/25/13 during a short visit to Charlotte. Appetizer was excellent -- croquetas and empanadas. The main courses were good, but not necessarily the Cuban taste that I grew up with. Service was good, ambiance is nice, bar looked very well stocked.

4Oj-ruS1M07Zz7gqgWOn1w.text: Came here one weekend night with a group of friends.  The food was delicious and authentic. The black beans and rice are a must. Make sure you finish dinner with a Cuban coffee! This would be a 4 star review if not for the speed of service. Our waiter was extremely polite and great at providing recommendations, but our drinks went empty more than once and we were almost finished with our main dishes before our sides showed up. That being said, I'd have no reservations about giving them a second chance.

qWmUJybQw9k7_f_cWh2aUw.text: I will give this restaurant a  big 0. They  don't have any respect for the costumers. I don't care is the food is acceptable, but the service at this place is really poor. Mangement does not know how to deal with the costumers. My phone was stolen at this location at nothing was done about it. Unfortunately was an Apple 4 that cost $600. I will not recommend a place.

iejn-a5jwHL3c0oes4IDQw.text: This is my favorite spot.  I love everything I have ever ordered.  The plantains are always cooked just right and the service is wonderful.  Very authentic Cuban food!!!

HDhdV78hWWe-s53RMob2Ww.text: Second try, never returning. I've been in the industry for a long time and I understand things happen but twice within two years means management doesn't care enough to stay on top of their employees. My ceviche was good, not the best I've ever had but edible. My husband's food was just gross - seriously,  how do you mess up a sandwich and fries? The fries weren't even cooked all the way. It took the server 45 minutes to take our order, two people at our table waited 15 minutes longer to get their food, beers were warm and mixed drinks ice was melted by the time it got to our table.  We would've said something but we only saw our server twice the whole time. I wish the server didn't add gratuity because she certainly didn't deserve it, not to mention adding gratuity automatically now is against the law for a few years now. Maybe if you didn't let your servers add gratuity I wouldn't be writing this review because she may have actually tried to do her job. The one positive was the band was pretty good.

z-U3DykIRXrfQuUUiMZw7Q.text: Unfortunately i visted this restaurant many numerous times since we moved to the Steele Creek area.  I absolutely loved it!  Then a year ago I had a girls night to celebrate my friend's birthday and they served me and 2 other women at our table SPOILED yellow rice.  I pointed this out to another server and told my friends not to touch it.  I averted potential food poisoning and embarrassment cause I recommended the restaurant.

wbL638pvp_NkMHk8RE060A.text: Service was beyond awful. What I ordered was unavailable and it took 20 minutes to tell me about it.  I lived in Miami for 10 years, and I wonder if these people are even from Cuba. Food wasn't very good either.

J1c69WiJgh-VZwLpUlsmBQ.text: We had a Cuban sandwich and a sampler platter. Sandwich was hard no mustard no mayonnaise no pickles.  sampler platter was very confusing. Could not tell what was what, All fried. Male Server was so not helpful. Very rude and curt.  Will not ever go back that is for sure.

eK1hYGtnhXU93o0xZ6v8yg.text: LOVED the crispy Beef with Rice & Beans and Pantains!!! Amazing! I will try the Cuban Sandwich during my next visit. There is a small stage and dance floor....I assume there's a live band during the week. Service was great and the food was amazing. I plan to attend a live show next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy Beef!!!

XuOCEC4q3hGUKB8fSjB66Q.text: Visited this location while in town on vacation! and wow! this place is lively and jumping on a Friday night.  I think it was because a local group was there meeting up.  Either way the Spanish band was fantastic.  I love live music! and people were dancing salsa.  It was very loud and I could hardly hear what my date was saying.  The food was just ok for me.  There was not a lot of seafood options of my liking, but I made do with was was there.  It was so so.  the fish I had was very tangy as if it was seasoned with lemon juice.  Everything else was good! I give it an A for atmosphere and and B- for food!  that's my food truth!

UVdJLXCvtGObKW25huNR0w.text: Ok so I'm giving them 5 stars if you love empanadas and mojitos, they have chicken, beef, and ham/cheese empanadas. Mojitos they have 13 options. I've never had bad service but I must admit I get empanadas, white rice, and black beans every time I come, come Friday night for a great live band.

EPrcungUKkwu-_MWiW5oQg.text: Food was ok. I got a beef dish wirh yellow rice. The cilantro sauce is so good! Live entertainment was awesome! Very busy and very slow service.

nLPFgbxg9nU5sVEKdq-JOg.text: I hate that I didn't have a better experience because I was really looking forward to eating here.   We made a reservation and ventured out on a Wednesday night.We were promptly greeted and seated in a booth... and then no one ever came back. We waited and waited and waited. We finally waited so long that I got up and went to the bar because that was the only place I could see any of the staff. I told a waitress we'd been sitting for 15 minutes with no server, and she said she didn't know who ours was, but she'd find out. Apparently our waiter was also the bartender. He was really nice, but trying to find him at any point during our meal was like trying to find a needle in a haystack (until it was time to pay and then he was Johnny on the spot.)  Our food was good - we got beef/ham and cheese empanadas to start, and then I got the Havana Pork with plantains and boiled yucca, and the fella got the Fried Pork with rice and green beans - but our service was so terrible that it colored our whole experience.  To end on a positive note, they did have live music, which was a nice touch and not too overpowering.

74_LH4tvHKptkLkMRbb-mw.text: Good food! Unfortunately...Without any disclosure they charge 24% to 21% tip included on the check. Don't get me wrong service was good and I planned on giving a generous tip, but I'm not a fan of being tricked into tipping an amount that I did not approve of.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

FB-lNnnjZbpZzRP3jN_Rfw.text: Ok, I've gone twice to this place. WILL not give it another opportunity. First time wife and I walked in and waited to be seated, and waited and waited.  Waiters passed us by and NOBODY greeted us or bothered to tell anyone that we were waiting to be seated. In fact, a guest there called what seemed to be the owner's son to seat us. At that moment again no greeting and only said...ILL BE RIGHT BACK.  This was about a 25min wait while standing in front of the hosts podium!  Wife and I walked out. It was then when a woman ran out the door to call us back. That moment we decided to leave because of the lack of professionalism. Ok. So I gave it another try. This time with some buddies and my 25year old nephew. Well dressed but wear a baseball cap. We walk in and he was immediately told he must take hat off to enter.  Of course he took it off and held it in his hand.  While seated he was asked to leave if he was going to hold the cap in his hand. Mind you, HE TOOK IT OFF HIS HEAD but apparently having it in his hand was a big enough offence that he was asked to leave if he continued to hold it in his hand.  In all. There will not be a strike three because I WILL NEVER RETURN to this OVERATED so called establishment.

D2jzQh9TiAuG3P_bVfrQ-A.text: This is going to be one of my new stops when I hit Charlotte. Great food, great service. Lunch prices are very appealing. Entrees come with two sides. Extra sides are very reasonably priced. Had the Havana Chicken, mixed beans/rice, and plantains.  I appreciated that even as a solo diner I didn't feel rushed out during business hour; the place is big enough that the staff isn't rushing to turn over tables. Recommend.

7b_wUUZS77WxP3GMDQ2nQg.text: Worst Cuban food I've have ever had. Beans had a funky taste (maybe burned). Ropa Vieja was dry, clumpy & so bad tasting I couldn't eat it (and I have never not eaten a meal at a restaurant before). Also, I ordered the smaller portions and brought/charged for the more expensive portions. Same situation with my wife who ordered the steak which had a good sauce on it but the steak itself was practically tasteless. My kids ordered Cuban Sandwiches & Miami Sandwiches but the waitress came back to tell us that they had none. No Cuban Sandwiches at a Cuban restaurant? That should have been my warning sign. When the bill came, we were charged for 3 extra items and a hefty tip was already included. We informed her of the incorrect bill and she corrected it but left the same tip for the higher amount. Basically she gave herself a 28% tip! I corrected the tip but because I know how hard these people have to work for a living I still gave her a 20% tip. Waitress was nice and apologetic but service was mediocre at best. I know there are not many Cuban restaurants in the greater Charlotte area but still would drive past this one to get to another one much further away. I have never said this before but if you're thinking of going here, think twice about it. Honestly, I felt like it was a waste of money.

MfNydfnCQLLlA0ofwFrV-Q.text: sadly, meat (Vaca Frita) was greasy, fries were really sad looking, plantains were ok.  service pleasant but not very good.  I read the reviews but someone else picked the place calling it "hit or miss."  Our visit wasn't terrible but I certainly won't be wasting my calories there again.  I don't know what your other options for decent cuban food in the area are, but I would recommend you look somewhere else.

48z40FPXBOZj7yHRCUhJyQ.text: Friday nights have live music, appears to start at 7pm, we (5 adults) arrived without a reservation at 6pm and were seated immediately but many others had reservations for 7 or later. Call ahead!  Shared the fried plantain appetizer, DELICIOUS, and everyone liked their dishes- pork, chicken, pasta, shrimp. Friend with gluten allergies loves to eat here! She says it's never crowded at lunchtime. Green beans, fried yuca and sweet plantains are some of our favorite side options; haven't tried the sandwiches but willing to go back!

eJ1Zf0L6ypcH3O9y334EpQ.text: I used to be a huge fan of this place. Food used to be great. Restaurant has picked up a lot of business and the food quality and customer service has suffered. If you are interested in hearing the band and grabbing a Mojito...great! If you order food expect a ridiculous wait and for your food to come out cold and burnt.....what a waste!

-naPU4mkb4I5kcFjHE1nEA.text: I have never been to Cuba or eaten at a Cuban restaurant before, so I have nothing to compare to for "authenticity" sake, but the food was downright delicious. The crispy beef with chimichurri was incredible. The Cuban style green beans were the best green beans I have ever eaten. And the fried plaintains were top notch.  Hamed provided great service.  We had an early dinner on a Saturday night. It was a nice, calm atmosphere, but by the time we were finished there was a band setting up so I imagine it could be livelier late at night.

sX0yoMIifmUfeLf6YAzUPA.text: Decided to try this local Cuban cuisine.  Service was great.  My shrimp scampi wasn't what I expected.  Shrimp with plain pasta and parmesan sprinkled on it.  Husband ordered a large plate that had mixed seafood and rice.  Very good!  Be forewarned, this is authentic so if order a plate that says calamari...you're going to get whole baby squid.  Not strips of calamari.  Live band plays at 7 p.m. (at least on Fridays).  We plan on going back!!

pBo5_83Fz10DB3BeI2Rj8w.text: I dont know i was just expecting something amazing when i was browsing through the photos and was a bit dissapointed. Food was decent.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy beef &amp; tropical steak pretty decent.

fYslU9Idh9k0ipukxzp37w.text: My daughter and I tried this place Sunday for the first time on a quest for the ultimate Paella. Unfortunately we didn't find it here.  In my opinion, there are two main criteria for a basic Spanish Paella since there are limitless variations out there floating around depending on what you want in it, albeit seafood, rabbit, pork, beef, chorizo, seem to be the norm.  The first of those two basics is cooking the dish in the traditional open shallow paella cooking vessel, usually carbon steel, which helps forms that wonderful socarrat as the rice starches caramelize during the cooking process. The second is the all important saffron for seasoning.   This paella had neither. There was no saffron flavor whatsoever and when the dish arrived within minutes of ordering I realized after looking at it it was assembled with a basic yellow rice adding the seafood (we ordered the Cubana version for two) at the last minutes. Obviously precooked.  The picture on the menu by the way shows two lobster tails, which makes it easier serving for two people but unfortunately it only came with one VERY small tail making it almost impossible to share. We were a little disappointed. On a scale of one to ten I gave it a five. The socarrat and saffron flavor just wasn't there.   On a positive note, the sangria was descent, if not a little weak, and the service was what you'd expect. Can't complain there.  Would I go back? Absolutely, there are several other things besides the paella I'd love to try!

LtXflPBb1lIDg6Ou6nwbnw.text: Stopped by here for lunch since it's close to work and have heard great things about this place.  I wasn't disappointed.    I ended up ordering the roasted chicken based on the recommendations I read on here.  It was surprisingly crispy being that it's grilled.  The chicken was accompanied by mixed rice and beans as well as some green beans.  Everything was equally delicious.  The menu had a lot of items that had me salivating so that definitely means I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch portion roasted chicken, green beans, and mixed rice and beans.

XjZ2UXQa57jnQnBS9pVcig.text: Delicious, 12hour slow cooked roast pork ... yes! give me some please   I don't visit Cuban restaurants often but this one delivered in taste . $11.98 for a dinner size portion of pork , yellow rice , and black beans is a bit steep for lunch but it was worth it . the lunch portion is $7.95 but I can't imagine getting full off of it.    Only negative I have for this visit was my coworker ordered the house sandwich and they couldn't fix it bc they didn't have any potato croquettes... they suggested a Cuban sandwich instead which was disappointing bc you get a Cuban anywhere . However, huge plus for giving a discount for the inconvenience.    Service was fast, friendly , and I love it when my drink is always filled .

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roast pork ... delicious

QfOaJ5qqH3h58kIV0xds7g.text: The food is very good but not consistently. The chimichuri is often over salted and the pork over cooked and sometimes the chicken is under cooked. I say that as an Afro Latina who knows how it should be cooked within the context of the culture. If you are not a white patron be prepared for horrible service. I eat here semi regularly because this is one of the ONLY Cuban restaurants with live music  in charlotte, if there were other options I would never go back.

OTgLAjvzYYa1Fg8OLqZ16Q.text: I was just a bit disappointed. I know every place sometimes has an "off night" and I think tonight's visit was one of them. Service was quite slow, sat for 40 minutes before our appetizer was brought out. We got the sampler plate and thoroughly enjoyed it. Good taste and was a lot on the plate. Unfortunately our main dishes were a little disappointing. I had ordered the crispy beef, came out a little cold along with the green beans and rice, that were also cold. Flavor of the beef was just 'ok', I expected a little more spice. My wife ordered the roasted chicken, and her plate came out cold also. After the plates were served our server never checked back. They only had a few people sitting at tables, so do not know what the problem there was. Perhaps the food sat too long prior to table delivery?   This restaurant has been here quite some time now so maybe they are starting to get a little complacent on their service and quality.   I doubt we will return because of that along with the other options in the close proximity that desires our business more.

3iBSbi-1sGqNLlRCubEnBg.text: My first time coming here and it was unfortunately a bad experience. I ordered the ropa vieja with white rice and sweet plantains and a side of tostones. The meat tasted plain, the white rice was definitely not fresh(refrigerated then microwaved) and the sweet plantains was cold as if it were just sitting there for many hours. The only part of the meal i could tell was just made were the tostones. Living in Miami for the most part of my life this was definitely not the quality Cuban food Ive known and grown up to love.   The restaurant was clean and had nice setup. The service could of been better because my waitress surely seemed as if she didn't want to be there whats so ever. She barely attended my table and was more concerned speaking to her other coworkers about God knows what but it sure wasnt about taking care of her tables. She came to my table twice which was when i ordered the food and when i asked to pay for the meal.   Maybe today was just an off bizarre day and hope that if I come back again I can have great reviews.

dtIt0pXGQRa5xtRmFeb_SA.text: The food was great tonight. I had the vaca frita and it was shredded which was something new for me. I thought this was unique and well executed. The drinks (mojitos) were on point. I did not have any disappointed guests and we came with 8 ppl. The havana sampler was amazing! Rice and black beans were just was I was looking for. However, the flan had too much strawberry glaze and a little to spongy but all in all great food and great music! Will return soon!

3HFhGFOGCnMAMDzxxP1z3A.text: Food was really tasty but service was terrible! The waitress told us they didn't have white rice or congri (what kind of Cuban restaurant doesn't have white rice????) and it would take over 1 hour to make it. Anyhow, we still ordered our food and they took almost 1 hour to bring our appetizer and another hour to bring our entrees. As we were waiting for  our food, we saw  many servers pass our table with dishes containing white rice in them. Our server was extremely rude and unresponsive, rolled her eyes and slammed the glasses and plates on the table. We usually give restaurants 3 chances whenever we don't have a pleasant experience. This is our 3rd and last visit. Each visit was worse than the precious one. We're never coming back.

D2MCYHUAjL86eAM0a2j5xw.text: Went in last night to celebrate the sale of our home. Was sat and asked for our drinks as usual. I order the Milanese steak with rice and black beans. The waiter was unfriendly and didn't seem to want to be there. He never asked how the food was either. When my food came I started to eat. I noticed some thing was different about the steak but I couldn't put my finger on it right away. Then it hit me; the cheese! The cook put white American cheese on the steak, not Swiss like you are supposed to. The cook also put a tablespoon of red sauce on top of the cheese when it was supposed to be covered with it. The rice and beans were cold as well. Then the check came. It seems that they charge a 3% convenience fee for taking credit card payments. I paid my bill and I will never return to this restaurant. I'm done.

p5yhBMLkf-KQobnBNP_V6A.text: Great food here! I had the Havana chicken with rice and beans. The rice and beans was very well seasoned and the chicken was great with their chimichurri sauce!  Prices are great too!

W60cMmtAwBCn06Y5yUQy5w.text: A really nice restaurant with great Cuban food...try the beef empanadas!  Service was friendly, but a bit slow.  Drinks were well-made - especially mojitos.  Would certainly recommend a trip to this place...and we look forward to our next visit!
