Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

31sYSms7gDLouoUO_VgEsA.text: The food was very good, but the live band was so loud, nothing else could be heard. I had to text my husband across the table so he knew what I said. The restaurant was busy with large parties and the wait staff was busy. It took 40 minutes to get a seat, 15 minutes to order water, another 15 minutes to receive the water. The waitress took our order but it was so loud that we could only point, not ask questions our first time there. Then hunt her down to confirm she got it right. (She didn't.) Overall a bad experience, but we may go back to try again, just not on a Friday night. My ear is still ringing the next day.

kN_F9h7iUmQ5ZZ-hZ_RBPw.text: Great food and atmosphere- salsa music on Fridays.  Food was excellent- they seat all the gringos by the window.  Tammy said the tiramisu was off the hook - just like Mamaw used to make it.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meet the three Amigos- smoking hot sauce and a beer I hadn&#39;t had - all three excellent.   Great Cuban food and music - come on a Friday.

G7X0hrrfU6OazUrr8uM4QQ.text: Live music made me feel like I was actually in Cuba or Puerto Rico! The atmosphere was live with people dancing on this Saturday night.   However, I didn't like the first waitress attitude as the first thing she said to us was that they were closing at 10 (we sat down 9:10). Like it's not about to close for almost one more hour! After we ordered our drinks, a different waitress took our food order. She was nice & courteous, and remained with us for the remainder of the night.   We ordered the Empanadas as an appetizer, Chicken Hemingway (chicken wrapped in bacon), shrimp in garlic sauce and chicken alfredo as the entrees. The Empanadas and shrimp in garlic sauce were tasty. The Chicken Hemingway could have used more marinade and seasoning as it was kind of dry and bland.  The Chicken Alfredo was okay, just a different sauce that we are not used to. Overall, I would come back to hear the live music and try something different the next time.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Alfredo
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Hemingway
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp in garlic sauce

WemYo6cQmcxCiDJhh9HQAw.text: Honestly, every time I come here I am extremely satiated. Only once was there a tiny blip but I'm going to chalk it up to a bad day. (There was absolutely no stuffing in the croquetas and the waiter would not replace them with fresh ones with actual stuffing)   BESIDES THAT...   I truly enjoy bringing friends here, coworkers, clients, my boyfriend and family here. I recently moved up to Charlotte from Miami in January so your girl KNOWS her cuban food. Although I would not really classify this as 100% cuban eats - this place does have your Cuban staples and the savory flavors are undeniable.   I've tried their churrasco, roasted chicken (my fave when I ate meat) and most recently the grilled mahi-mahi. All were superb. Highly recommend any of these options if you are indecisive.   They also have a pretty extensive mojito selection which I have been dying to try!

OdRSmRQb6Ex5nH0fcnIb5A.text: Service left a lot to be desired. Overall, the food was very tasty. But I had ordered the Cuban sandwich and they brought me essentially just ham and cheese. When I asked where the roasted pork was they tried to oke-doke me saying the "recipe had changed". Then it's not a Cuban. It's a hot ham and cheese. And the menu needs to be corrected.

Gic2yXNQMblCrdv8bDp7sA.text: The food here is really good, my go to is the crispy beef. The mojitos are great. The only downside here is the service, they move a little bit slow when it comes to greeting you but they make up for it by being super nice once you're seated and getting food/drinks out timely.

NnZntmLQ1NrNXpFoPkARcA.text: Went there last night and the service was absolutely horrible. It took 1.5hrs to get our drinks, mind you our table was right next to the bar.  The waitress was clueless. The food came out 3hrs after ordered...some over cooked, some undercooked and some didn't even get their food at all. My salmon was burnt, dry and served with no dressing  (see picture below). They had the nerve to bill us for food that we refused to eat. Not to mention, the bartender made my drink and was licking and sucking his fingers in the process. My friends wine glasses were dirty with lipstick stains on it. When confronted about the drinks, they got an attitude. I will never eat there again.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

gm_7eU6YYmO_BQygiwJ9-A.text: Nice place tucked away in Steele Creek. Service was excellent. It took a little longer than normal to receive dinner since there was a private event. There is live music  each day. The bartenders were very attentive and polite. Food was hot and savory!

U5erdKjr8m-n6ukotN4xvw.text: Fist time ordering from here and I was disappointed. There were some good items but because I got a app platter. The steak was rubbery and lack flavor, the chimi sauce was over powered with oil, the beans were semi soft, and the green beans weren't anything Resturant style. If you want food that is wholesome but no flavor this is place.

JsGKNnsuQR5hcY6G7vnoGg.text: I'm falling out of love with this place.   Don't get me wrong--when it's good, it's really great. However....  My primary complaint is the lack of consistency, which I've heard from others also.  Each time we've come here, they're out of something--skirt steak, plantains, whatever. Sometimes they have closed before their posted closing time. Sometimes the bartender is not there during the dinner hour, which is sad, because I love their calle ocho mojitos.  I just never know what to expect.  I really hope they step up their game.

I3J6XpNRI5YIBbMT4Bdcyw.text: I've tried this place twice and both times the service was lousy along with the food. I love Cuban food... The first time I ordered the whole fried fish and it was over cooked and tasted as though it had been cooked in old oil, my plantains were over cooked as well.  my girlfriend ordered some dish that contained shrimp that weren't  de-veined.. The only reason I gave it a second chance was because  she loves their mojito's.. This last time I ordered Pollo a la Habanera, rice and beans, and plantains. The chicken was over cooked and lacked any seasoning at all.  She ordered Ropa Vieja.  It did not taste or look like it has other places.  She pushed her plate to the edge of the table and our server (Manuel) asked what was wrong.  She proceeded to explain that it did not taste as expected. He responded that it was their signature dish, then proceeded to ask what was wrong with it in a harsh tone.  I interjected and stated that it was different from what she had before and maybe the recipes were different.. He snatched the plate away and did not return for 40 mins.    The overall service was terrible.. We had to grab another member of the wait staff in order to get another drink, another member of the staff refilled her water, and I was never offered anymore tea by my server.  I kept my cool no need to get upset it wasn't worth it..   In conclusion.. I've had two bad experiences at this establishment and I love Cuban food.. I love food period. In order to get me to write a negative post you've really had to screw up..  The bright spot of the night was the entertainment though.. Loved the band.. They made the atmosphere very fun and pleasant..    If you're ever in the DMV you should look up Cuba De Ayers..

-HsD-c52w8cbZ3Wqly2eLg.text: Amazing restaurant, friendly staff and AWESOME food!! Good to know u can find good places to eat around Carowinds besides fast food.  Had the skirt steak with green beans and fried yuca; everything was delicious!  Tres leches cake was sooooo good!!  Service was excellent :)  I truly recommend this place, amazing food, and affordable prices.

AaoMdMGadgaHl0WDqazgVw.text: So I have been here multiple times and I would have given it a much higher review had I not had the experience I had last night. I suggested to a few girl friends that we have a Monday night girls night for Sangrias and dinner. I have been here before and the food is always good and the mojitos were always good so seemed like a winner. Well that's where I was apparently wrong.   Our waitress had to be the nicest WORST waitress in the history of the profession. Two of us got there at 5:30 and were seated at a table. We decided we'd like to move to a booth so we were waiting for the waitress to come back. This is where the night of waiting begins. We didn't get out of this restaurant until about 8:45 when it was all said and done. Every time she'd come by and say oh I'll be right back it became a minimum 30 minute wait. Took us over an hour to get our food not to mention the hour it took us just to get to order the food. The Sangrias were really bad. Tasted like concentrated juice (without added water) and really sweet off red wine. The empanadas were tasty and my friends chicken soup looked and smelled amazing. Our main courses came out not as hot as they should have considering the wait and one of the orders came out wrong. 3 of us ordered the crispy beef and somehow my friend got a different beef dish instead. I got a mojito after the bad sangria which I again didn't drink because the basil was discolored and slimy and it was really watered down. I have never had a bad drink here before so I'm not sure why it was this bad but something changed.   Now as I was watching I gather they only had 2 people working the floor and the bar last night so they were short staffed. I was prepared to just say okay they are having a bad day. We order dessert, she's picked up the pace here at the end, and the bar has shut down so pretty sure they wanted to close up shop. She brings us our bills and we notice that gratuity has been included already. Also it's a hefty gratuity (over 20%). For my one friend that was the last straw for her and she asked to speak to the manager. We asked if it was customary to add gratuity to a group of 4. He says yes this is what we do here. Then another friend asks but it says we are a table of 6 not 4 on our bills. So then he back tracks and says oh no she put it in wrong etc. (I feel here there is a language issue going on and want to give the benefit of the doubt but I probably shouldn't). The whole thing was a mess. We had an enjoyable night in spite of the bad service but that was due to good company. The food was good but definitely not as hot as it should have been considering how long we waited.   Overall I'm giving it 3 stars because I've been here before and the food, drinks, and service were good. However If I was basing it on last nights visit I definitely would give it 1 star. Also my tres leches cake was not very good... tasted like grocery store cake where the bottom had been soaked in condensed milk. This could be skewed because I've had amazing tres leches cake in Charlotte and this didn't live up to it.

ruKdZz88ZUAr-zTTYemWuw.text: Hands down this place has the best mojitos in Charlotte!!!  This is the first restaurant that I've been to in this city that puts fresh fruit in their mojitos, I recommend the strawberry and mango ones.  The decor and overall atmosphere is really enjoyable, we went on a Friday night when they had live Cuban music.  We were also told that later that night, they'd open up the dance floor for salsa night.  The service was very prompt initially, actually too prompt.  I've always had a pet peeve around being given my entree less than 5 minutes after you brought my salad out.  Other than that one slip up, the rest of the service that night was excellent.  The food was very fresh and tasty.  I had the calamari, chicken Caesar salad and the Havana Pork.  The calamari was very fresh and had a nice tangy dipping sauce on the side.  I only had a couple bites of the chicken Caesar before my Havana Pork came out, so I can't really comment on the salad since I just had them trash that.  The Havana pork was nicely seasoned and extremely tender.  Based on the way the pork was cooked, I'd recommend their pork dishes to anyone.  Pricing is very reasonable, most entrees run between $7-16.  If you're looking for good Cuban food, A Piece of Havana is a great place to go.

E32vruLAvFDKT9B15Aukhw.text: The worst servers ever! It's a good thing that the food is good. I sat outside  and got no service what so ever. I had to go in to order, get my check and pay! They tend to forget the tables outside.  There is nothing worst to me than bad service. Service completes your overall dining experience. What a shame!!

i9rnyp-tlkDvaVymKwLfCQ.text: Finally made it here, and I must say DAYUM...so good! Roasted pork dish was awesome. I will be here more often

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. ROASTED PORK! Bang

B8e0L9OsAJaXZNkI_8aBgw.text: My family and I visited recently and had an amazing meal.  It is refreshing to be able to go out for Hispanic food - and not have Mexican.  I'm not hating on Mexican food; it is good.  The Cuban experience is totally different.  The restaurant had a laid back feel.  Nothing is rushed and the staff made us feel very welcome.  The servers took good care of us without standing right over top of us.  My husband had empanadas and Cuban Skirt steak.  Amazing!  Tender, flavorful, amazing!  He had extra chimichuri sauce brought out - not because he needed it, but because the sauce just makes your taste buds happy, happy, happy.  My Crispy shredded beef, again, was just delicious!  My daughter enjoyed her Shrimp Scampi.  We both had enough to take home for lunch the next day.  I recommend that you make certain to finish with their Cuban coffee.  When they bring out this tiny cup you think "What the heck?"  This little coffee will knock your socks off.  Wow!  Noone needs to drink more than one of these.  The flavor rocks! Any more than 1 cup would be too much.  Weekends there is a live band.  It can get loud with the band, but, just ask to not sit right next to them.  Or, you can even sit outside when the weather is nice.  Delicioso!

2xlLa8shAxRoyfhLVimacw.text: One of the worst restaurant I ever been, I went with my friends last week we were sitting at the bar trying to get a drink, no body even bother to ask us if we want some  drinks those bartenders were just looking down at never looked up we tried to get their attention but they didn't care so it took 30 minutes to get a drink, so I don't recommend that place is just  my friends and I will never go back there.

Y3hMLLhZvn0Gp0_x1xCNaA.text: Firstly, this was my first visit.   Just to reiterate.....service is well below par. With that being said the food is meh. It is neither good nor bad. My boyfriend and I were hungry so we tried one of the combo platters made for two. It had steak (salty, chewy, and overcooked), chicken (seasoning was minimal and it also was overcooked) and lastly pork (this was the best meat on the plate). It also included white rice which was ok and some plantains. I ordered the empanadas....one beef and one chicken. This was the highlight of the meal. Beef was better but I did enjoy both. Lastly, you are supposed to get bread with the meal....like many restaurants it comes before your meal. I asked once we received the main course and our waitress said that they were out. Probably something you disclose at the beginning of the meal. Well come to find out, they were not out. I'm sure she noticed my unhappiness with this news and came out a minute latter saying that they would have it right out. So basically she lied.....not sure how you go from being out to all of a sudden having some stashed in the back???   Needless to say probably won't be coming back. If anything....I would order the $2 empanadas and call it a night.

jWjskgp2AiOI_QGJ3LtdVA.text: I went with a large group to A Piece of Havana and over all had a good experience. I was born in Miami, FL so I am use to Cuban culture and food. Had some croquettas for an appetizer they were ok not quite how I remembered them but not bad. For an entree I had the Havana pork which was much better than the appetizer. My wife had the Milanesa Steak and it was also good. A WARNING this is a Cuban restaurant and is going to have a laid back atmosphere. You will most likely not get in and out quickly. If you want to talk and have a few drinks this is a good place to do it while having decent Cuban food. But if you want a quick meal I would not recommend it. I gave 3 stars becuase although the food was decent I never felt the need to go back again.

siG4sxEqqwMXGvCuUkhSgg.text: I promise I wanted to like this place. I moved here from New York and my family is of Cuban descent so I was excited. To see this place...until I tried the food. The sandwiches are DRY. the pork is DRY and unseasoned. All of the food lacked seasoning and the empanadas were more grease than anything. It was very disappointing. I guess for people who don't know what the food is supposed to taste like then this is a great place but I will NEVER eat here again. I literally feel sick and like I'm gonna vomit.

fTmNWeqUt-2kDF-rMIJvbA.text: Very good .. had the mojo shredded pork with Cuban rice and beans and tostones .. empanadas as apps .. everything was very good!!

0XSuOA4gRiwnXGgnj3q6PA.text: Oh my gosh...I never leave reviews but felt compelled after eating dinner here.  My wife and I lived in Ft. Lauderdale for 6 years and became fast Cuban food fans.  It's been years since I've had Cuban this good.  If you like Cuban food...this place is the real deal.  If you've never had Cuban, you're missing out.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Have a Mojito while you&#39;re here.  Cheap and delicious!!!

5RGwDLds9lH2ePIV6pcOQg.text: Went with a prearranged large party. Service was terrible, because the support staff was not supporting our waiter. Drink orders were taken once, delivered, some to the wrong people, and almost never thought thought of again. When they finally took or orders (40 minutes after we arrived) it still took another 40 to be served.  The food was far from good either. The seafood and chicken in all the dishes was overcooked and tough. The only reason our drink and water glasses got filled was because all of us were asking. No one even came and asked how the meal was.  I spoke to the owners, a husband and wife, and while she was somewhat apologetic, she several times tried to lay the blame on our group for not telling them what to do. Hey, hears an idea - how about you the owner come over and see if everything is okay.  In the end we were served three complimentary flans, but it didn't make the situation any better, especially since the came out over cooked and burnt on the bottom.  I don't think any of us are ever going back.

ZrW9cUDBcFy7M5NLCWHPWw.text: NOT HAPPY.   Service was awful.  Food came wrong. I was super disappointed.  Mojito was good though.   Will never go back. Got the stank eye when I let them know I had issues.

xzSWIthIOpoQOsfi5rBnYA.text: We had a great experience here tonight. We ordered Cuban sampler appetizers, which were very tasty, although some weren't as warm as I'd prefer. The mojitos were fantastic (definitely try the coconut). For dinner, we had the Parrillada Cubana which had pork, Havana chicken, and steak. It was great and I really liked the rice which had a lot of flavor and definitely added a lot to the meal. Our server did a great job pacing the meal for us and she was quite attentive, in spite of what some other reviews have stated. Definitely recommend folks in the area try this place out!

KvZx1hkGJC7CE8INuJArtA.text: Feels like I'm back in Miami. The vaca frita is THAT good! It's light and crispy, no greasiness. The empanada sampler is also tasty ... but filling. Could be a meal all on its own. Live conga band covering great music from the 80s tonight (friday). The location of this restaurant however isn't quite right; A Piece needs to relocate closer to Center City, maybe Elizabeth or Central Ave.

d6XypzVOFk1r00JOm6MjyA.text: I consider myself Cuban by default... I was born and raised in Miami and just left two years ago. That said, I was so excited when discovering this home away from home! I have to admit I was skeptical at first but they had me at my first mojito!   The food is muy rica (delicious) and very on point with what Cuban food is. We started with the mariquitas (thin slices of crispy plantains) and they transported me to calle Ocho in little Havana!  I ordered my favorite dish- vaca frita and it did not disappoint. We ended with flan and tres leches for dessert. Since then we have gone back several times and had great experiences. Never a bad dish.  They have live music on the weekend (first was a great salsa band.. Another time was just a Latin dude and his keyboard).   Either way I am a fan and when I'm craving some good old Cuban cooking, that is where I head!

WifOgEFATGacNVhTiDTQFw.text: Not bad, but it could have been a lot better. To be fair even in Miami it's not easy finding really GOOD Cuban cuisine these days.  The Ajiaco soup didn't have any pumpkin or chunks of meat, it was very bland. The roast pork was OK but needed lots more mojito and more onions. The masas de puerco (fried pork chunks) were cut into too small pieces, they were fried right but the chef failed to use any garlic which is a must for that dish. This restaurant doesn't even offer chicharrones de pollo which is like the best fried chicken in the world and the so called "Cuban turnover" was an Argentine empanada.   The sides were solid, the congri (rice and black beans) was not typical but way better than usual, the maduros (sweet plantains) delish and the tostones tasted like.... tostones.   Prices were very reasonable, portions were generous, service was cheerful and you better drink tons of water before bed to compensate for all that salt.   There's potential but the chef needs to get a lot bolder with his spice rack, mojito and garlic.

OyvuV9hvifCwARkJEDviZA.text: This place is doing Cuban food right. I've been here several times and will continue to come for as long as they're open. Staff and servers have always been friendly and I've never experienced any long delays. Food has always been exceptional in presentation and taste. For those who aren't sure of what to order for the first time. I recommend going with the ropa veja and crocettas as an appetizer.

7qfA4Uuie1LmSsHKDm-Jpg.text: Amazing food and service.  And good music to boot!  Get the empinadas, yucca, plantains, and tropical beef.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

fzsdcqksnmTEGVDhNnT86A.text: 2nd time we have been there and customer service is an issue. We waited 20 minutes after being seated we left no waitress or water even offered.

LqQWq4OT8bWbQpu5PcewXQ.text: One of my favorite lunch spots. Great prices and fresh, delicious Cuban food. The crispy beef, tostanas, and congris are my favorite - but everything is pretty great.  Only thing keeping me from giving 5 stars is that the service is always very slow. The waiters are nice but it just takes forever to get orders in and pay. Would be nice to be able to get in and out in 30 mins but you'll need an hour here at least.

zDRepX03eO3XjQ8BkmE98g.text: If I could give zero stars I would!!! Service was absolutely terrible!! Went here yesterday with a friend we both order something different. She order shrimp scampi and I ordered Cajun shrimp. My dish was soooo salty, I could barely eat it! It was terrible and my friends pasta was drenched in oil, just disgusting. We ask to speak with a manager and was told thirty minutes of waiting that she wasn't in the building. Needless to say I was very dissatisfied

RWivKerq7r5r5wOi8K6G6w.text: Randomly drove by and I don't drive by a Cuban restaurant without trying it. Ambiance was good and service was quick. I ordered the pork with rice and black beans, it was delicious. Not the best I've ever had but, worth having again. Mojito was pretty good too. With two drinks and two entrees, meal came out to 35$... Can't beat that.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

UsPrsNyoe1dkeFjkZLU8GQ.text: This is sad. We liked the upbeat live Cuban band music. People were dancing up a storm and having a great time to the beat. The decor is attractive and the food, while not spectacular, is good. However, they water the mixed drinks at A Piece of Havana, an action so fundamentally dishonest that my partner and I will never go there again. I ordered a Mojito with Bacardi Superior rum. It contained zero rum--water, ice, and mint for flavor. When I sent it back they took it off the bill but without a word of apology. For me this is a deal breaker. For you, well, caveat emptor.

cf-_fH6zxsfwAubcbjO-Pg.text: Very good restaurant. Not in love but it's good Cuban food. Ox tail was pretty good. I've definitely had better. Their chicken chunks however were really good. It is a citrus alternative to Mexican. I'll be back.

FD6XOQPkAZQcvuEkPuG-8w.text: I give the food a 4 star, but the service was pretty bad.  We had to remind the waiter 3 times to bring our drink and he told us the wrong information on a few of the dishes we ordered.  I will definitely go back, just with lower expectations on the service.

590cPzDP-9LV47aaJ8vL_g.text: Anyone who knows Cuban food can tell the difference. The taste of the beans taste like Mexican beans. The pork chucks  ordered were saturated in oil. Any Cuban knows that pork is supposed to be accompanied with limes, which at this restaurant they do not even offered with the food, the rice was extremely dry. I am sorry, but for real Cuban food please don't waste your time. Go to Miami one day, and taste the real Cuban food.

RWjHXj2ch6DBQeQ8_lcbzA.text: Best meal in steelcreeke! Always thinking about this place's mariquetas and Cuban coffee. If you can't stand the waits, come in on a Monday or Tuesday. Open table is also a pretty decent solution for you aren't spontaneous. There's always some type of event to look forward to in addition to the amazing food. Friday is salsa lessons!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. The amazing cuban coffee.

wyOHZp40XcLQMfCkiJr7Nw.text: I went here last night with a few friends before we went over to Cajun Canvas.  The atmosphere is nice and festive.  The chairs are all leather, but sit very low.  Our server was friendly, but probably could have checked on us more.  We went for dinner around 5:30 or so and it was pretty empty.   I ordered the Havana Fantasy drink - and boy, do you get your money's worth!  That drink was strong!  It was very good - and it was $8 - so honestly, I was glad that I could taste the liquor I paid for.  I felt like this place was ok, and fine.  Then our food came...  I ordered the shrimp in garlic sauce with Cuban toast and fried yuca.  That's the moment I became a total Piece of Havana fan.  The food was delicious!  The sauce and shrimp dish was just right, the bread was great, and the yuca was crispy and amazing.  Maybe it was the strength of my drink that made my dinner taste so good, but I will definitely be back.  Everything was reasonably priced too, for a nice dinner out.

VZJuZq9aDxhgOEdwyQoVxQ.text: First impression: The location is nice and had a great atmosphere. We were greeted immediately and given a table (not that they were busy). I enjoyed the decor but I will say that their leather chairs were a bit uncomfortable.  Nothing like Cuba Libre in DC (amazing decor!) but for NC it is a great ambiance. Now about their food...    *sigh*  What a disappointment when I drove almost 2 hours to eat here. I got here about an hour before closing and I guess that wasn't enough time since our waitress was rushing us to order. We came here to have this GRAND experience and left with nothing but a decent steak sandwich that I ordered after my disappointing meal (that she put TOGO without asking and I had every intention of eating it in the restaurant). My mother started off with a sangria which she gave it an "OK" it was on the sweeter side but still a decent sangria. Between my parents they split a Paella (which was huge) but they had no lobster! It also came with no sides and cost almost 30 dollars. The Paella was good but not the best, the rice was not fully cooked and the clams were closed shut! I on the other hand ordered their garlic shrimp with yellow rice and sweet plantains..... and I will never order that dish again... ever. I figured out their special sauce! The shrimp was overcooked and was chewy and the "special" sauce overpowered the dish.... all I can say is... Mojo Criollo anyone?? The yellow rice was cold and all I enjoyed was my sweet plantains.   I will come back again with an ample amount of time and hopefully the food and service will be better. I love Cuban food and thats the only reason why I can't turn my back on this place just yet!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Shrimp with Yellow Rice and Sweet Plantains

PDyPztjAttgNY0Lu8Gwz8w.text: I met some friends for lunch here on a monday. When we walked in, we were seated promptly by the host and given menus. The atmosphere was very nice, and we were looking forward to our meal.  Unfortunately, our waiter seemed as if he didn't want to be there. we waited about 20 minutes for drinks, and another 20 for him to come take our order (and he only came over because we were all staring expectantly at him). He never came to check on us once, unless we got up to get him, or flagged him down (which was difficult, as he never seemed to look towards the tables, instead keeping his head down over the screen to the POS ordering system).  Once the food came, everything was delicious, flavorful, and well prepared. Such a shame that the horrible service ruined it for us.

c-6hSXCKhswT8KLj8sxxaA.text: Go someplace else. Had dinner here and we spent $50 (with no drinks) and left dissatisfied. We left thinking the only thing that was enjoyed were the plantains. It is a clean restaurant with attentive service though.  Visited October 2013

cuPSi0tNt1XngZW5Uvw8Ww.text: In Atlanta, there was a shack of a Cuban restaurant that was so authentic they had a picture of the raft they came over on (I'm not kidding about that). I ate there at minimum once a week. While not quite as good, this place has been the closest I have found so far. Definitely a lot more upscale than my Atlanta spot, which had bars on the windows, but the food was really good and reasonably priced. I had a beef empanada and the Media Noche. The Media Noche was pretty good but the empanada was outstanding. If I had any room in my stomach, I would have ordered 2-3 more of them.  They place is tucked away at the end of a strip mall but now that I've found it, I'll be back.

7MLy-8DX9w14bRK9roSEUg.text: Good and atmosphere was amazing. Def felt like I was not in Charlotte for a couple hours.

7tLwxHucyLHePbneFhKUGA.text: One of the hidden gems in the greater Charlotte area.  Amazing Cuban food (recommend the garlic shrimp), great atmosphere, authentic mojitos and very reasonably priced.  You will not leave disappointed.

RhV2mkydSwrd33Teklf6qg.text: Based on the reviews this was a must try while visiting Charlotte. Had the Cuban with sweet plantains the bread was a bit hard but over not to bad.

Q1CVX-T7sCNHpe_pGP-7YQ.text: Music and environment was entertaining. I went specifically for paella and was disappointed. Will return to try another dish.

yUuM3iCHfNnip4gqj6eUPQ.text: I really tried to give this place a chance several times because I am of Cuban heritage and grew up to enjoy Cuban food. Each time I went with my mother who speaks fluent Spanish was great, but when I have gone by myself it was a whole different experience since I do not speak Spanish.   The first time, the service was so bad. The hostess had an attitude with us and told us we had half an hour to eat. Our waitress came to our table only twice. We ended up having to speak with a manager and she gave us a $15 voucher for the next time we came in.   So the next AND LAST time we came in we tried making a reservation for 8:30 and the man who picked up the phone kept telling us that they closed at 9. I told him we understood that but we were driving 2 and a half hours to eat at that particular restaurant. He then told us basically that by the time we got there we could not eat within 20 minutes. We got there anyway at 8:30 and were able to finish our meals by 9 no problem. Pretty sure the same man served our table.   We ordered the croquette and empanada platter. When it finally came out we received 5 empanadas and no croquettes. We were only informed then that there were no croquettes and we got 1 extra empanada. This did not seem fair because we were still charged the $9 for an uneven number of empanadas when there were two of us and we were supposed to get a total of 4 empanada and 4 croquettes. He then asked us how many empanada we would rather have and if he should take the extra one away. He almost grabbed the 5th empanada with his hand.   Our next peeve was that we specifically asked for the salted plantains instead of the sweet ones as our side and we got the sweet ones instead. He then told us that since we said plantain instead of tostone, we got the sweet ones. Right after that I saw him go up to another coworker with an attitude and point at our table.   Overall we will not be returning again and will take our business somewhere else. Being open until 9 does not mean you stop serving half an hour before and that you have a limited time to eat. I have worked in the restaurant business and if you cannot wait for customers to finish eating after the time you close then you should not be working there. Being tipped is based on the quality of service that is deserved. It's very poor management and extremely rude. It is such a shame.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

g41GSluN8F_Mwmc7aVgD2w.text: We've been craving Cuban fur the longest and ended up trying this restaurant. We had the app sampler, only thing good in that plate was the tamale, everything else wasn't good. We ordered the skirt steak and ropa vieja but unfortunately they were very bland. No flavor, this food had nothing of taste that I can say it was Cuban. Definitely not a location I will be back too.

4_J4fEKv3-BFsmRpqP7Zig.text: Wait...what? I recommended this restaurant to my daughter & son-in-law, who were served cold Moro, cold chicken, etc. Plus the empanadas ordered where wrong & COLD...number change won't make a difference if I never eat there again... Pa la pinga!

pzW7uzO9RpxlHKXpct532g.text: Considering I've eaten twice here in 30 days I decided it's time for an updated review.  Every visit I have made to this restaurant the food has been delicious and except for my first experience the wait staff has been good.  What to try here:  The empanada sampler - they taste amazing and come hot fresh out of the oven! The dipping sauces served alongside the empanadas are a wonderful flavor addition. The Argentinian Parrillada with Malbec - I am going to venture a guess this meal would comfortably feed 3 instead of the 2 advertised. The real surprise when we ate this meal was that on a plate of meats, including steak, I have to say the chicken was the winner! I don't particularly care for bone in chicken but it was prepared perfectly with generous seasoning and every bite was juicy!  The Cuban sandwich - I can only get so excited about a sandwich personally but my fiance adores this sandwich and orders it consistently when we go for lunch.  Chicken Bacardi Alfredo - I am surprised to be saying this as well but my friend ordered this at lunch and I had some serious food envy! The Bacardi alfredo sauce was unique and delicious.  It's proven to be a solid date night location with large comfortable booths and consistently delicious food and drink specials. I am glad I went back and tried them again.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Potato salad and side salad
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. All the meats!

4pQVBFjyDJ-Q0uhgqywkiA.text: Live music on fridays and sometimes even on holidays. There is a great atmosphere and the staff is friendly. Make reservations, as it can get full and you will be waiting for a while. So far I have had nothing but good experiences here!

Dm2SFu0C2A3_ls0nqGbHnA.text: I've gone to Piece of Havana several times over the years and the quality has always been consistent. I would recommend trying their tropical mojitos and going on Friday and Saturday evenings when they have live music. The atmosphere is great but make sure to get there earlier as they do fill up quickly. Something they can improve on is their service, as it can be but slow and the servers don't always check up on you even when the restaurant isnt busy.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Havana appetizer

Pei9dTZC6PG5liV1KAAXNg.text: Very good food, drinks and ambience.  I would recommend the ox tails,  stewed beef or empanadas!

xVMYZPwSUTO8v3tcixKQXg.text: I went to A Piece of Havana to get a Cuban sandwich for lunch and was told that they couldn't make one. The waitress said that they were out of pork. Seriously? You're a Cuban restaurant! This is the main dish at a Cuban restaurant! So sad...

JTgHdIT274mgC7xj3zRGvg.text: Place was nice. I'm originally from New York and have been out here for a year, being Puerto Rican it's hard to find authentic Spanish restaurants out here so this place did it for me. It was great food and the service was also very pleasant. The waiter brought me the wrong drink and before I could say anything he already had my correct drink and apologized. I would say for it being such an authentic Spanish restaurant i wish it had more Spanish music maybe. I would absolutely come back here.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ropa Vieja.

u3OoG0r0PE1xQEth6luZVA.text: Neat little place , they were live music the Friday I got take out , the whole fish was dry as was the chicken but they have all the things you would expect I will go again

Uog7YZh5qBaY5kuE1dL9Sw.text: I'll start by saying if you have all the time in the world then this is the perfect place for you. If you have plans later do not go eat here. We came in party of 6, the host sat us right away. Then we noticed she was also the waitress, the bartender and food runner and helping in the kitchen. This was Saturday afternoon. Took forever to get menus and place drink orders. We just ordered everything at once when she finally came. With that said the food was really good, definitely no complaints there, everyone was satisfied with their food. Big portions too. If you like adult drinks they have specials everyday so that's pretty cool. So 3 stars just for the fact we didn't plan on spending the afternoon there lol

_6FkpiJX7UO6sqkD4lryow.text: This is the only place in Charlotte I go to when I want a real Cuban experience.  I've been here several times-- the last of which I had ceviche, cuban style green beans, yellow rice, a long island iced tea and crispy shredded beef.  Moreover, we went on a Friday night and there was AMAZING live music and dancing.  While there was a wait because we did not have reservations, I did not mind sitting outside on the patio-- it was a nice night, and the Long Island was EXCELLENT.  Our wait was not nearly as long as expected, and once we were seated the food did not take long either.  Our server was so kind and helpful as we decided on what to eat, and did I already mention there was a LIVE band?  They did their thing, really.  If you're into an authentic Cuban experience-- ambience and all, then this is the real deal.

0DiyzFNllhIRf-VU6Bhwkg.text: Their Cuban sandwich is amazing. The place is authentic and the food is great. The prices are good too. Definitely recommend this place!

55F0725zXB3BF54t58mq0w.text: My boyfriend and I came here for the first time and were super happy with our experience. Our server was awesome and the food was even better. We will be back!

TNvdc7VgWZZ95jFBFCelRg.text: Absolutely fantastic!  If you havnt tried it, you really need to.  Authentic home style food made fresh.

D0q5uIbpfLm3kBYQLxRfYg.text: Amazing experience for my mom's birthday that coincides with Cinco De Mayo. Live band was absolutely amazing . I couldn't sit still in my sit. We danced the night away. The atmosphere was welcoming. Mojitos, so many flavors, yummy  food. Definitely coming back and definitely recommend.  Pro Tip: Every 3rd Friday there's live music and dance lessons ( Call ahead to double check)

OSwypcKUlbYYwutBHGzkHQ.text: I have been in this place 6 to 7 times in the past 5 to 6 years.  The food is losing its taste... salty and no taste. The service was terrible.  It took almost 15 min  before someone came to take our food order.  After we ordered it took almost 50 min before the waiter came to touchbase and referesh our  drinks.  The food took another 15 before we were served. Will not go back!

iwSW7oR67_040FZb5T0yXA.text: First time visiting restaurant for a birthday dinner. The music was great  did not know there would be live music, what a nice touch! We had the empanadas, ham and chicken. The ham was better. The cilantro ranch was good as well. For the main course we shared the paella cubano... omg it was out of this world! It had lobster, shrimp, ham, chicken, and clams. It was plentiful for more than 2 people and we ended up taking more than half of it home! We will be back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paella cubana
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paella cubana

MG5e5XCgRwx4RG98vgPvNA.text: We love A Piece of Havana!!today everything was so special the food was incredible amazing!! The shrimp in Garlic and olive sauce was the best shrimp I ever had. And the service was also outstanding. We had several visits before and while the food was good the service wasn't. Today we notice that they were more attentive and on top of every detail. Mojitos, flan and the live band made it even more special!!

jq4LX3gTssSed5VOmwJpXw.text: living in Steele creek for 10 yrs. Tonight (6/19)was my last time at this restaurant. Only time food is good is on Friday and Saturday night. Tonight our waitress was the most rude person I've ever seen in a restaurant. First did not even acknowledge us 10 min after being seated. We order cocktails,  and dinner 15 min later no cocktails. We ask about our drinks and she rolls her eyes. At that point my husband and I just got and left. The restaurant was not busy and the other waiter was helping his tables. I'm a physician, I don't like to complain but We will NOT spend our money here! It's a toss up if you'll get good service and good food.

Dkr_5CxnKBTKm_bVVDAXTA.text: My wife and I love this place. First, make a reservation on the weekend or you'll have to wait in line. Second, make it around 7 pm, so you can hear the live music.  Get the fried plantains and avocado dip, and a mojito to get started. apps, music, mojito. Everything else is extra. Enjoy!

lMcSitzLsZJvKJ4NyRNWpw.text: I'm no chef Ramsey but disappointment from what I tried last night. I left the restaurant hungry. I really wanted to enjoy this experience but it was far from it. Waiter was slow. He was acting confused from the very beginning. I didn't understand that. I love when there is a language barrier because I feel like the food would be more authentic but not for this case. I ordered a Cuban sandwich. It was cold. The bread was dry and not even hot pressed. Ham was cold, mealy sliced tomatoes, mushy mess of ham croquettes, cheese had started to solidify. So opposite of what I was expecting. Also fries were soggy. I really wanted this place to be good because just moved from Wesley chapel and miss Bella Fresco Cafe and Gelateria in the Arboretum. Bella's I would have no problem recommending but not Piece of Havana.

nWn1flZ8idVqzbQVZTzKmQ.text: Super disappointed! And after reading the first few post on Yelp we should have walked out! But we gave it a chance. Nothing like a "Real Cuban Restaurant" An hour before even getting there the phone rings...rings...or busy but when someone finally picked up and I asked I was put on hold forever and he NEVER came back on!! The hostess said it would take 45-to an hour wait. After an hour wait we are still waiting but we 2 big groups of people to sit. When I approach the hostesses reminding her I been waiting and I was there prior to those groups. I was told they had reservations lol!!! WOW!!!!  Finally we got to sit down to a table with nothing!!! No water!!! No Cuban bread with butter!!! Crackers!!!!NOTHING!!!!! 10mins later the waitress decided to show up. By this point we had our order ready. No "oh give us a min" we told her everything we wanted. When the food comes out she tells me they ran out of fried banana?! HELLO?! Seriously?! For the prices they charge the portions are small!!  My breaded steak was brunt, the chicken my step daughter got was super small and my husband steak was very skippy!!  Not sure why we ordered cafe con leche more or a disappointment!! It was rusty!! Then they only have just plain flan?! Once again even more disappointing!! I'm honestly convinced the owners are not Cuban this would have NEVER happen in Miami or Jersey!! This is why Cuban restaurant never make it here in Charlotte. Considering this is the ONLY!! One how they made it around this long oh yea because people do not know how bad it is!!!!

DVkcbyqdwVYWIn9xrYGuAQ.text: I deem this place middle of the road.  Seating is comfortable and the noise level is low - good for a business lunch.  But the food is average at best.  Did not "pop" with flavor.

jiNGQXmWtvjutJcC4aMDkQ.text: My first trip here and I enjoyed it. Great restaurant and the food was amazing and authentic. Tuesday was half off wine by the glass which made my meal perfect. Friday's and Saturdays they have live music and the place is hopping.   I gave 4/5 stars because the food was great but we were sitting at the bar and the service there was ok. Maybe the service would have been better if we had sat down at the table. But overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crispy boiled beef

hlsPmvjkXAHL1Xod1DQmXQ.text: I ordered at dinner a Delicious veggie platter -under salads! Came with veggies and plantains! I ordered with yellow rice and veggies .Beans would be a perfect addition as then would be a complete protein! All delicious! Colorful and I will be back!  Husbands Mahimahi was good but he felt portion was on the smaller side, flavorful though!

YxcdbAapIGkFkdmLe67CJg.text: Saturday noon and it was closed. It looked dirty inside, some used lime slices on one table. I tried the phone number and no answer. I went by the hours indicated on yelp or their web page so wasted a trip out there.

hh3x2Gowl5UkvQNrkRZFNQ.text: The food was good. Mojitos were average. Cool ambience. Friendly service. ... But for a party of 2 I feel that we waited too long on a day that Wasn't busy for our drink then food order to be taken.   Lots of personalized decor adds a nice touch to the feel of the restaurant.   I can still confidently recommend,but I worry about the speed of service on a busy night.   I had the shredded crispy beef.  .  Pretty good !

VW4fz7AanhgHuvQj-z3Z-w.text: I have to admit the first time I went here the service we had was a 2 star performance.  It would have been a 1 star if we didn't start asking other servers for things (turned out our original server couldn't care less).   Having said that, the food was what brought me back - never had fried yucca before!  The second visit was a complete 180!  Our server was super-attentive and kept the cups full and checked up on us consistently and always with a smile.  The food was again amazing - I could seriously eat their chimichurri sauce out of a bowl.  This time there was a live musician and the atmosphere was electric - people got up to dance in the front as well!  The coolest thing I noticed was that most of the tables were larger groups - which probably aided in the festive atmosphere.  You'd be a fool to not try their fried yucca and if you're really going for that food coma- definitely get the tres leches for dessert!!

UkoJBG-o551PFFUNwnZm6w.text: Wonderful!! The only reason I didn't give perfect 5 was because the space is very small and crowded and I ordered a sampler plate so that I could try multiple items, and the roasted pork was AMAZING, the steak was "good", but the chicken was "blah".... We came here to celebrate my husband's birthday and he and I both had a wonderful time-- the band was absolutely amazing, the vibe made us feel like we were in Little Havana in Miami, everyone- patrons included- were happy and lively and having a wonderful time. If only they had a bigger space so that you didn't feel so crowded it would have been perfect.  And again, the food was delicious, over all, but I feel on a sampler plate where they have chosen the best of the best authentic items for your to sample, everything on the plate should be outstanding. The chicken was really dry and wasn't seasoned....the steak, again, was good, but not great....the star, by far was the roasted pork...OMG!! Soooooooo Amazing! I truly hope they expand and open another one of these somewhere else in Charlotte, as I feel it This cuisine and culture is missing here(and I live in Mint Hill, so SteeleCreek is kinda far for us to get to).  Can't wait for an opportunity to return....

2sg9GZh8b8Lx9HtGXnLhEg.text: Definitely a disappointment!  I had high hopes but all quickly went downhill when our waiter informed us that most of the ingredients needed for their menu selections were unavailable due to Hurricane Irma - seriously!  Responsible owners should know when to keep their doors closed.  Management made no apologies to customers.   Es Una Pena.

5BClIx-6tRFKtEx9WBjOGA.text: Food is ok. To start I was expecting Cuban bread not old sour bread. The mojo for the tostones no good. Service was nice looks clean. Pork chunks were dry. The sauce for the fried yuca was pretty good.

C4R74TkdU5epAAuVXqE9Ng.text: I am from Miami and love Cuban food. They do a good job and have a really nice place. Go, eat, Easy to get to too.

OkA0pUMOCWXRZglMdGdtBA.text: Super tasty food. We all usually get the same thing each time. I get the pollo ala plancha. It's tangy thin chicken. Lish. Then I get white rice and black beans. Today I tried the beef empanadas with yellow rice and black beans. Awesome. My brother always gets the chicken sandwich and yucca. Service is a tad slow but it's worth it.

QlkdUuAJ8ZXbJtplJFzvjA.text: The food here was wonderful. My date and I had mojitos for drinks that were fresh and delicious. I ordered the chicken and he ordered the Cuban sandwich and we both shared the appetizers. the waitress provided great service. I will definitely be back.

BBgeDGMJ5WcIQh7r0MLJSQ.text: We stopped in for dinner last night and had sort of a bumpy experience. As a disclaimer, this was Valentine's Day weekend, so I can understand them being stretched thin. Although, the restaurant was never totally full during our time there.   There was PLENTY of staff to go around, but it still took a very long time for our server to approach. We placed orders, no problem, but almost never saw our server for the rest of the night. Others came around to top-off our drinks...at one point, topping off my diet soda with sweet tea. Somehow, our absentee server saw this happen and brought a replacement, which was nice.   Food was just okay. The Cubano is not the best I've had, and the fried yuca was disappointing. We never did get silverware, and only got napkins because a bus boy spilled water on us. Also took ages to get the bill, which turned out to be for a different table. So we had to hunt down our sever again and have her fix   Overall, the place is clean, staff is friendly enough, and they have good live music some nights. Maybe they are better on a regular night. I doubt we'll go back, though.

dxQQ9nWJn_R_j2NcGJe2cw.text: I'm a huge Cuban fan and had such high hopes of this place, but unfortunately am leaving disappointed. Ordered the Lechon Asado lunch portion with boiled yuca and plantains (my go to dish). Pork was cooked very good but the marinade was incredibly salty to the point of being overpowering. This is not normal for this dish.  The yuca was very undercooked and tough to cut/chew. Plantains were great, but also pretty hard to mess up.  All said, the price was great at $6.95 but flavor and quality were very low too. Too bad because they have a great atmosphere for sitting in a strip mall area.

PBdUIR4F7vTxccc9MptJPQ.text: Just like the name, it give you a taste of Havana. Food is good and cater to American taste. The atmosphere is friendly, service is good. A good place for lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Roasted chicken with black beans and plantain.

oM5dA6z9ol_vsM5Dc-B50g.text: Right away I liked the look and "feel" of this place.  They were busy for lunch today (a Wednesday) mostly men in white dress shirts and ties filling tables for four.  This place has some character, is comfortable and is a lot nicer looking than I was expecting.  I ask one of the waiters about Cuban Style Espresso and told me to try something else.  I do not speak much Spanish so I have no idea what it was, though the name sounded really good and he seemed confident that I would like it.  Since I believe "Fortune favors the Bold" I thought I would see how I liked it.  This Coffee with milk had a good (not great) flavor and it was better than many, though miles from the Great Cuban Style Espresso I'm used to!  What he described as their approach to Espresso Cuban Style sounded close (close but not quite) and I probably should have ordered it and will next time.  OK I know I'm crazy and I do not speak Coffee, so I'm part to blame!  They serve their Cuban Sandwich with Mayonnaise, yet you can choose to have it with none as I did!  This Cuban Sandwich was very good, the pickles were thick, the mustard could have had a less dominant presence though I'm not counting that against it!  Swiss Cheese, Ham and Pulled Pork, YUM!  This sandwich gets 3.85 yelp stars, because I am almost a fan.   Instead of Fried Potatoes (french Fries) I substituted ($.99) fried Plantains (the sweet kind).  The Plantains were perfect...5 yelp stars!  Soup of the day was Corn (Not the Creamy style) I guess it was a broth or water base, was flavored nicely and had some meat in it, 3 yelp stars.  The service was Superboy on Cuban and if you do not know that is a compliment.  They made one small mistake on my order yet fixed it before it left the kitchen and I know they don't think I saw it.  They put fries on the plate and my server caught it before he picked up the plate to bring it to me.  Five Stars for Service!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. If I spoke Spanish I could tell you what this was!  Coffee with Milk and sweet

vJFVjDgjW5mR4pwECjY_3A.text: Love this restaurant! The good is always tasty and the atmosphere is always fun! On Saturday nights they have live music and dancing... Great to participate in or just as background noise.  The BEST part is their mojitos! They're huge, strong and inexpensive!   My only complaint is there's always a long wait.

cz1-A-nfohQkLKJwMgkYvA.text: AmaZiNG ordered in person for take-out & wait was reasonable food is delishhhhh i want seconds just thinking about it !!

fmQuKaR9TQFaEevVoD33VQ.text: The food was really good, but this antique racist maid knickknack figurine made me feel uncomfortable.   The mammy stereotype portrays black women as obedient maids to white families. Like blackface, racist objects such as mammy jars perpetuate deep-rooted stereotypes about African-Americans by portraying us as dumb and animated.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Antique racist maid knickknack figurine made me feel uncomfortable.

yname_Ro_aSBxQipqfWldg.text: Short version: go on a Friday or Saturday night to enjoy the live music and some dancing. Food is hit or miss and service can be slooowww.  Long version: Went there with the family over the holidays for the music and to get a taste of home. Having grown up in the restaurant business (a Cuban one at that) and relocating from South Florida; it is mad hard to find a decent Croqueta in Charlotte. Such a staple in typical cuban bakeries yet, apparently in Charlotte, bakeries are not licensed to fry foods so coming across a Croqueta in this town is already a challenge.  Anyway, I was excited to try this place out, especially since they call themselves "Authentic". We arrived on a Saturday night and the music was going. We very much enjoyed the musicians and even did a little dancing. That is where the highlights end.  We ordered 2 samplers (which have my very sought after croquetas), a Vaca Frita, Rabo Encendido, a Miami sandwich and Mojitos. The Rabo encendido was very tender and well seasoned. The Vaca Frita however, was over cooked and bland. The Miami Sandwich, though it had slightly different ingredients than the typical, was pretty good. The samplers however were extremely lack luster. The croquetas were mushy and almost smashed looking. The other items were just "ok".   The mojitos were pretty watered down but were much better after we asked the bartender to re do them.    Overall, go for the live music. The dishes are hit or miss and the service can be slow but friendly and accommodating.

_5Io0YwCJQcwW8eG40p1Pg.text: Exquisite!!! The food was delicious and the ambiance was great with live music. The service was on point never for a moment did I wonder if my food was ready or if I am going to get a refill for my drink. The waiter was entertaining we spoke about the how they have established themselves. Loved every moment spent there.!!!!

BHacoqE-ee61ICKKPDxKVA.text: This is a place that is so lively!! It is upbeat and the live music is fantastic. You cannot help but to get out of your seat and dance. There is live music on Friday and Saturday nights. I had black beans and rice with a aide of avocado. It was so delish. My friend had black beans and rice and pulled pork. She loved it. The sangria is fresh and not too sweet. Definitely a place to go and have a great meal and dance your heart out at the same time.

NAPWbUG1NXc44US8-HPcmg.text: Just moved to Charlotte from South Florida and happy to say this Cuban Gringa felt right at home at this authentic Cuban restaurant. The ambiance, service, and food was everything I had hoped for. We had a fabulous dinner, including ropa vieja, churrasco, Cabernet, and two cortaditos. Not to mention, we were greeted by the manager and owner to make sure we were enjoying our experience. My boyfriend and I are foodies, and find it difficult to enjoy a restaurant that can deliver a great meal, at a fair price, and great service all at the same time. But, I am happy to report that "A Piece of Havana" knows how to do things CORRECTLY. Can't wait to go back and enjoy some of the other food items. We were completely satisfied!

gCR4iMFSjX_5ZZZCmZMH_A.text: This was my second time visiting here but first time reviewing. My parents were in town and we tried to go previously on a Sat night but they were completely booked for the whole weekend.   So .. I made sure to make reservations on OpenTable this time and we made our return  We were seated with no issue. I recommend first getting the havana sampler it allows you to sample empanadas, fried yuca, tamales and more.   We ordered drinks. The sangria is delicious and their mojitos are some of the best. I also had a Mangotini which was good but it was so small it was laughable.   For the food my parents split the Parrillada Cubana a combination platter with food enough for two. They got their bang for their buck with it. I got the Milanesa bistec with rice and plantains. I LOVE their plantains and my stepdad even ordered some more for dessert.   They had live music which started at 7 that night and our reservation was at 6. The band was pretty cool. Our food probably took 20-25 or so mins to come out but we didn't mind since we had drinks and were wanting to be there when some of the music started. On a regular day though the wait time would be unacceptable.   We also went to have some dulce de leche cake for dessert however they were out of it which was disappointing.   Overall, the food was good, seasoned well, a good amount, the service was okay, and it is definitely somewhere to come if you want to experience a different atmosphere.

xSfXQXU644zhukmp4I1QIg.text: We haven't gone back to this place since the first year they opened up. It's changed so much. The food is much better than I can remember. The portions are very large. Their steak was very juicy and delicious. The chicken was on the dry side. The rice, beans and plantains were perfectly cooked. The atmosphere was nice with Cuban music playing.

fw6uEC-jUlzbU2kEXG1PQw.text: Not an authentic cuban place. They did not know what a Medianoche was and the mamey shake was rather bland. We order the cuban sandwich and steak sandwich. Both we fine. The platanos maduros were well done. Probably would not go back based on our experience.

2jmRlhRBeTVT0jaF1J4dNw.text: This was our 2nd time here. We've been wanting to come to A Piece of Havana again because we loved our first experience here. The live music gave a great ambiance, there's plenty of space/seating, the service was great, and the steaks we ordered were unforgettable. However, our second experience was not as great as we remembered. We couldn't remember which steaks we ordered our first time here (we did remember it had chimichurri sauce on it) so we ordered the Churrasco and Palomilla. I asked for my dish (Churrasco) to be cooked medium and it was served to me well-done, so I had to ask for another plate. The steak was okay, but I thought the Palomilla tasted a lot better. Overall, the food was good and the service was okay. I'm giving this restaurant 4 stars because our first experience deserved 5 stars and our second deserved 3.

5Jgc9-EZ-iRchC2zgPGwzw.text: My first time here was awesome!!! The Chicken Bacardi Alfredo is delicious. The music was so great I could barely sit still to eat! We went on a Friday night and there was a live band. It was super crowded but service was still awesome. I will definitely return!

hh3qxtOwXCTIX8HLr8Fc7A.text: First and last visit.   Poor service.   No plantains at 4 p.m. on Saturday. Maybe there's a recall?? Most Cuban restaurants that I've patronized over the past 30 years included a chicken entree.. not here.   I had to request a napkin.  I was never asked if I'd like a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. First and last visit

vum2kpn5hKeR8uJddyHjag.text: I went here like 3 years ago with some co-workers.  I've spent sorta a lot of time in s. florida, and for years the only Cuban food I've eaten came from refugees.  There's not generally a lot of it (cept in Miami) and good cuban is amazing, so I like good cuban food and I don't really bother with crappy cuban food.  So couple three years ago when a bunch of rednecks from the warehouse area of Charlotte suggest "cuban" I almost stopped them, but I was in a good mood so I let it go.  I didn't have any reason to expect much.  After the meal I remember thinking, at the time, that this place was too good to be in Charlotte.  I finally got a chance to come back tonight.  My family is here with me, we're killing time in Charlotte, and my wife loves cuban food.  We popped in, she eyeballed the menu, we went for it.  There was a singer in tonight; she was pretty legit cuban, thick accent and all.  And *very* good.  Like "is this candid camera" good.  She was beltin' em out for 1.5 hours (we hung around after our meal), and still at it when we left.  A few into her set she dedicated (in English) a song to the kitchen, then repeated in Spanish.  After the translation they erupted in applause, so I guess the kitchen is cuban too.  The food was over-the-top amazing.  Crispy vaca frita, SUPER tender and juicy.  Black beans + rice were great, maduros as well.  My wife won't stop talking about the empanadas.  After, when we ordered dessert (flan) and coffee, our waitress ("Estephanie" lol) asked "cuban coffee?"  It's sorta like gauging a barbecue place: you order tea, and if they bring out sweet tea you know it's legit.  If they ask ("Sweet or unsweet?") it's touristy but probably ok, and if you get unsweet then you should probably eat elsewhere.  I always ask for "coffee" in cuban restaurants, and north of Miami I just get crappy coffee.  Here it was the real thing -- absurdly strong and sweet.  Just like the rest of the experience, it DID NOT belong in a strip mall outside Charlotte.  This place is the real deal.  If you are at all curious about what cuban food (or people) is like, please come try it.  Prices are great ($12 entree!!!), service is great, everything is genuine.  This is now going to be a required stop when we're in town or driving through.

EDIPhxL12TdBLuhg1PRung.text: Any Cuban Latin jazzy music fans in the house? If so, I strongly recommend a Friday night visit to a Piece Of Havana. Found within which warm friendly atmosphere, extraordinary service, and drinks that will have you ready to get up and try your steps. Initially thought of being good and simply ordering a caesar salad, but the lure of oxtails won me over, and oh, was I happy that I made them change. Their oxtails were tender, extraordinarily seasoned, and pleasing to the palate.. A taste of the empanadas also proved to be a wise choice, especially the beef. The washing is down with the cool crisp mojito, I was ready to try my Latin two step on the dance floor with everyone else... Come on down on Friday night and get your tastebuds pleased and your dance step on at a Piece Of Havana.

351UXlKgRu14WCaJcIWGFg.text: I've eaten here before loved the Cuban sandwich it felt like authentic Cuban food. The only negative I have is that it's quite a drive from where I live but well worth the wait. The mojo chicken is delicious since they use a marinade to flavor the chicken.

nWoSK6fNCH_yXQKlfPYyVg.text: Service and food quality has dropped throughout the years. Small portions so not for the hungry. Nice ambiance.  I recommended a friend to try it and he wasn't impressed at all ... embarrassing to say the least .

AuiN-oXIvo61qEdgFwHF_g.text: Haven't had too much Cuban food in the past, but I have enjoyed the cuisine when I have tried it. Came to this restaurant after a long day at Carowinds and was hoping to get in and get eating because we were so hungry. We go to the restaurant and waited a couple minutes for hostess to help us. We were checking out the money and debating whether or not to say because there was a wait, but hostess told us of the next door lounge that is same food, but in different environment. We went next door hoping to be served quickly, but similar situation arose. Finally after being seated we were quick to decide, but didn't have much help with questions on the menu. Waiter was kind, but wasn't informed on the menu as well as he should have been. Food came and I was expecting a hot dish of sea food, but it instead came out cold and he said that is how it is supposed to be, but there was no mention of this on the menu. Food was alright, I really liked the plantain chips and we still had a good time with the music playing and the neat looking building. I probably wouldn't come back unless I heard of changes in the speed of service.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Outside entrance of the building
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood dish with plantain chips

QRMg7Y19as_-glE9BK6m-A.text: Visited this restaurant for the 1st time last night.  I had a friend in from out of town who loves Cuban food, so I figured this would be the perfect place.   I ordered the boiled yuca in sauce and my friend ordered the croquettes as an app.  The croquettes came out steaming hot unlike my yuca which was ice cold.  I had to send it back, 1st strike!  I ordered the only vegetarian option (disappointing); my friend ordered the ropa vieja, and again the meat dish came out steaming hot and my dish again was cold and not to mention the plate had more rice than vegetables and my maduros were black!    As the waitress brought my yuca back to the table, I just handed her back my plate and said, "this is cold too"!   After a few minutes, enough for me to eat my yuca, my plate came back out, this time the presentation was different but that is besides the point.  The food looked hot and was hot however they simply just took the maduros from the cold plate and put back into the new plate..... I took maybe 2 bites, only to be completely dissatisfied!  The vegetables tasted sour and of burnt garlic, not to mention the maduros were previously burnt and now cold and I even had one that was literally a rock!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sour burnt garlicky vegetables
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Burnt but cold Plantains / Maduros

CjlNQOJe94REPMsLnesKwg.text: I lived in Miami for many years so when I moved to Charlotte it was really hard to find any authentic Cuban restaurants this is the only one I've found the food is amazing! Palomilla steak with chimichurri sauce is what's I always get! The empanadas are to die for you Ambiance on a Saturday tonight is great they always have live music! Also mojitos are awesome. I'm giving it 4 stars only due to the fact the service is very slow but if you are not in a rush than it's not too big of a deal. If you like Cuban food this is the place to go!

3rH-9fjf02IEQ_rGPkalOQ.text: We went on a Wednesday night and were treated to live Flamenco music, and half price bottles of wine. The food was great! Plantain chips were freshly made and delicious, the croquettes were perfectly cooked and great tasting. I ordered the fried pork chunks, it was okay, the pieces should have been cut into bigger chunks instead of the tiny pieces that turned out to be too crunchy but with good flavor. When visiting family in NC we'll go back to A Piece of Havana.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States

FFmMKUrUFyp_-qRScUGwWw.text: While visiting Charlotte, my group decided on Cuban food for dinner.  I am so glad we chose A Piece of Havana.  The entire experience was amazing!  Service was great.  Food was SPECTACULAR (huge portions)!  The vibe is really cool.  We went on a Friday night and they had a group performing. There is a small dance floor where patrons could salsa and mambo.  It was so much fun!  If you're nearby, be sure to check it out.

uabWxOSOgT5zvbcTdOmRLQ.text: This place is to die for!!  The shredded beef is by far the best dinner entree available on the menu! they have delights like the empanadas, croquettes and much more! it's even amazing for takeout. If you stay later in the night you will enjoy the lively salsa dancers!

sDBTpUeHxnkYJuIC_Ny4rg.text: I've been back to A Piece of Havana twice since my initial review.  I have not encountered the snooty person as on my first visit and have found everyone to be very friendly here.  On my second visit here, I just went with something listed as a favorite on the menu and it was decent, just not something I was expecting.  On my most recent visit, I asked my server for a recommendation and he recommended a shredded beef dish.   Now I am not a big beef eater but this dish was absolutely amazing.  The crispness of the beef is what did it to me along with the chimichuri sauce.  For a side item, get the green beans!  They are very flavorful.  The fried Yuca was good too but I've had better at a Peruvian place.  I spent a little time talking to my server and I think this is a place I will bring the dinner group very soon.  I've never been here for dinner and some of their menu options they only offer for dinner so I am looking forward to trying them.  One odd thing,  The chairs here are custom made.  The backs and seats seem to be made out of leather.  The only problem is that I sunk down a bit when I sat down.  I felt like I was sitting in a hole.  But that's the only flaw I saw with my latest visit.  Good stuff.  Check it out sometime!!!

d3g3IwB1KO92XNsfFONHhw.text: There are very few Cuban restaurants in Charlotte.  So, I give this one a four partially out of scarcity.  If you live in South Charlotte, definitely go.  It's a hearty, flavorful meal.  I don't know if I would make a trip out of it from huntersville, let's say, unless you just really want Cuban food.  In all, I thoroughly enjoyed it, however.

Q5vv-cYCIYDtZwcSnCX7mA.text: If you are looking for a super-quick, super-affordable lunch and find yourself in this area, A Piece of Havana may be worth a try.  I ordered the roasted chicken with mixed rice/black beans and plantains.  I think the dish was $5.95 which is a great price.  However, I was a bit disappointed in the chicken - it was tasty but a rather small portion. Sadly, the mixed beans& rice was a bit dry and did not have a lot of flavor.  The plantains were good though.    On the plus side, the service was very good and the food was delivered  super-quick.   This place is not bad overall and if I happened to be in the area I would probably give them another try.

2-in3wdCXBGcrfJio2kY4Q.text: FInally had a chance to check out this place. I'm a large proponent of Cuban cuisine and had put off trying this place for far too long. It's a trek from where we live in Dilworth, but I'd say it's damn worth it. Located off of South Tryon past Carowinds, It's in a small shopping center, but as it's own building.   We stopped in on a Saturday night and we were greeted with live music. It was awesome. The guy was singing his heart out and I'm happy to say that he was really good. It wasn't unpleasant at all. Actually added to the ambiance.  We started out with the avocado dip (basically guac) with fried plantains. Dude. I'd highly recommend getting this. The dip is pretty commonplace with other guac varieties, but the fried plantains make for a really nice change-up from plain corn chips. We cleaned the plate between the three of us.   I went with the Cuban sandwich. I have to order it any time it's offered at a Cuban place. Happy to report it's a textbook sandwich. Flaky Cuban bread, yellow mustard, Swiss, pork, ham, dill pickles. That's all you need. Ordered it with a side of tostones. Mashed, and fried plantains served with "mojo." Basically an oily, garlic-y dipping sauce. It's amazing. Super mild and a nice touch.  We also ordered a couple of the gin mojitos. Have to give these a big "meh." It's a great idea, but the grenadine really killed the flavors. It was just too heavy.  Service was incredibly friendly and cordial. The place was packed and the guys on the floor took care of everyone with a smile.   Cuban dinner round #2: Coming very soon.
