Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuban salad
Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cuban rice, Cuban toast and boiled yucca

kPeNQrEjo9ZoyH6GphOcIQ.text: Crispy beef OH MY! Delicious food. Live entertainment. Good people. I still don't think they cooked my food in olive oil like the waiter said though...

_vzwRl0SaJxuu0EKVz5HvA.text: I would give this place 3.5 stars if I could.   Normally I love going here. I think they're food is excellent! I get the shrimp in garlic sauce with Cuban toast and green beans. The meal was swimming in garlic. Almost literally. I didn't finish because it was so garlicky. Pretty sure I am going to smell like garlic tomorrow. However, I do love some garlic, so this will not deter me from coming back.   I also got the house made sangria. It is $3 on Monday which I think is a good deal. For all of you beer lovers a pint of Coors light is $2 everyday. Back to the sangria, it was ok. Vey sweet, but a good compliment to the meal.   I thought our service was great. If I could just rate our waiter I would give him a 5 out of 5 stars. Very attentive and helpful with making our decisions.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drink specials

bruKI1SvsmjOTIQFuSBong.text: Really good Cuban food for being north of Tampa! The Cuban sampler appetizer was great and the ropa vieja was really tasty.

pU-paZeOX72EoU-ljnouTg.text: I really wanted to like Piece of Havana, but was instead horribly disappointed. This place fell flat in every single way it could.  Let's start with the service.  It was severely lacking.  There was barely anyone (only 2 other tables) in the entire restaurant and it still took an obscenely long time to get anything, from our initial drink orders to refills to even our food.  If they were slammed I could understand, but the waitstaff spent most of the time chit chatting or watching one of the TV's mounted on the wall.  Now, the food.  I don't believe my standards are unrealistic.  There's plenty of good Cuban food to be found outside of Miami, all it takes is a little effort.  Also, it shouldn't be overpriced.  We're not talking foie gras or lobster here.  Sadly, this place suffered from both bad and expensive food.    First of all, the Cuban salad was a joke.  It was the bare minimum needed to be considered a salad and clocked in at 8 dollars.  There wasn't even a dollar's worth of ingredients on the plate.  Then there was the Vaca Frita which should have been called Vaca Greasy.  It was served in a little bowl swimming in grease and fat.  There was nothing Frita about the dish with all the meat hanging limp and dripping oil.  The chimichurri sauce was equally greasy and unappealing.  I'm not even going to talk about the rice and beans (a staple dish of any Cuban restaurant).  Suffice it to say, I've had better at Taco Bell.  The one thing they did well where the Mariquitas and the avocado dip.  That's it.  The best part of the entire depressing meal was the appetizer.  This was a bad experience across the board.  I don't understand why such little effort was put into what could otherwise be a fantastic place.  The decor is great, they have a solid looking menu, and the right ambiance, but it fails at the very essentials of any restaurant, food and service.

om4BGlUULnEe_rzGxlPA0g.text: Mojitos are very good.  Empanadas are delicious.  What a great restaurant, so excited that Charlotte has a great Cuban place to eat!   If you are even considering a visit, by all means come here for a great meal. Picadillo is also very good.  Great steak sandwich.

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Picadillo!

97AGmNYWJmRMC8hiIgCahw.text: A nice change of pace.  Started with the Havana Sampler which included foods made with corn, plantain, pork, and ham.  All of it very enjoyable. For dinner we split the dinner for two . The pork was incredible and the steak we full of flavor.  Cuban coffee and tres leches for desert were also very pleasing .

q8r2mc6xtl7iKtjAzw-7Tg.text: Urggghhh where do I begin. We made reservations for 8pm on a Friday which making reservations is a must especially on the weekends. We arrived on time and was seated right away. After we were seated we waited 20 minutes and no one had even came to our table to greet us. So my boyfriend got up and went to the hostess who came to our table to take our drink and appetizer order. Another 10 minutes past and a guy that seemed to be our waiter brings us our drinks and ask if we wanted appetizers to which we told him yes that we had already ordered them. Another 20 minutes later we received  our appetizers. A little crazy as we have now been there for over 40 minutes. We quickly ordered our entree when our "waiter" brought the appetizer because we didn't know when we would see him again. We waited another 20 minutes no food. The staff looked disorganized with their full attention on a large party celebrating a birthday. I needed some air so I walked outside and told my boyfriend if our food is not here in 10 minutes we are leaving. He talked with the "waiter" who went to get the food. Finally at last a Christmas miracle came and our food came over an hour after we arrived. By this point I was over it and over the lackluster food. Never again. If I was completely exhausted and hangry I would have spoken with the manager.

Oyd62G3LND9IoIXNGBLDvw.text: Food was fabulous. Service was ok, server seemed nice just rushed us because she said the were closing in 20 minutes.  It was only 8:30. Prices are fair I suggest the churrasco steak

UK6irpbhvGz-ljHLP-01Vw.text: My go to for Cuban food for lunch. I passed this place dozens of times before me and my fiancee finally decided to try it, and we were not disappointed! Their lunch prices are really low for the amount of food you get. But let's get into the important stuff, the food. I can only speak for the beef and chicken dishes but both are amazing! Flavorful and moist. You can't go wrong. For sides, I usually get the beans and rice and plantain and both are always made well. I have been several times and the food is always consistent and fresh. For $6 you can get a quality meal the same price as fast food. You can't beat it.

AivcyIJeLuMK06Ua-I7bjA.text: I just want to say this about the Restaurant...my family and I went in and there was maybe 4 people seated in the dining room and the bar was full..but plenty of open tables. We go in and say we need a table for 4...she looks at us and says we don't have any tables they are reserved. I was like really...she was like you can sit down but you have an hour to eat. What a joke...I was going to give it Another shot and call and do reservations..but they don't seem to be great with answering phones. So right off not a very good Impression of the place. Hopefully the owner fixes the reservation problem...Bc it's complete bull.

NQLKqNptmTUiSkR9QwaPxQ.text: Went for my b-day dinner, a little disappointed this time. They have changed the menu some, deleted some items. and this night they were out of couple of things all together. Good news they are opening a "Tapas" lounge right next door, so they will be connected. They also did some changes to the dining room - not sure if this will stay that way, but honestly wasn't overly impressed with the entire night. We did order an app, they were out of ham croquettes, and they no longer serve calamari in the main dining room - they said they might in the Tapas lounge. Service was good - server nice. Want to go back for the Tapas lounge to try it out, the restaurant not sure we will eat in there anymore.

m2M_1ntcMdkbBJ7MMuOXOg.text: REALLY wanted to like this place - this past Saturday was my 4th time there in the 6 years I've been in Charlotte. Sadly, I think NOT! To begin with we arrived at 5pm, restaurant had a few patrons. Asked to be seated at a booth and was told they couldn't as it was reserved for someone at 6:30 pm. REALLY? You're going to deny paying customers a seat because the booth is reserved 1 hour and a half later?? Makes no sense - in the end we got the booth but were warned that we would have to be done by 6:30 - fine! Ordered the shredded beef dinner entree and my husband the skirt steak and we both agreed we'd never eaten something so bland and tasteless at a Latin Restaurant before. Had to order salt, pepper and hot sauce to pour it on and see if it picked up a semblance of flavor. Totally unhappy with both our meals - we are definitely NEVER going back. Oh and the icing on the cake - I ordered a drink (which the menu stated "in a martini glass") they forgot to add the word "mini" in front of martini glass. Yes, the drink came in a MINI-Martini glass. I actually asked the waitress "Excuse me, did the bar run out of martini glasses or is this what your drinks regularly come in?". She said it's what they typically come in - SMH. In the end, waited.....waited....waited....waited for our waitress to appear. Had to flag down a different waiter and asked him to please find my waitress as I needed the check. Couldn't get out of there fast enough. Not sure how this place actually has positive FOOD ratings - maybe I caught them on an off day? Every single time I've been there?

pTqgXxWVu-t3qUzGpvalnw.text: This is a cute little place, authentic Cuban food, first time I went there,  food was delicious  I had the rice with black beans and pulled pork with a side of plantain. Taste great, but then every time I order something they prepare it different from the first time. I know they cannot be changing chef that fast. I also love the Yuca,  but with the constant changes I cannot take it anymore.

XodYiVUWGgY_pNTPnuKpbg.text: The first thing that impressed me was the daily specials. In my opinion, that is never a bad idea, especially on drinks. They had a decent bar selection and their mojito came highly recommended. I love Cuban sandwiches, so I couldn't wait to try the "Milanese", a breaded beef steak or chicken breast, with lettuce, tomatoes, ham and cheese in Cuban bread. They use American cheese in the sandwich and when I tried to order it with Swiss or Jack (my twist) the server looked confused and slightly hesitated, so I just let it ride with the American cheese as-is. My friend ordered the homemade chips and guacamole and it was really good. My sandwich was good, it came with a side and they featured a good bottled beer special that night. We also got a mojito and it was actually as good as word of mouth. The Menu appetizers include Papa Rellena (Stuffed Potato with ground beef), Empanadas and Tostones Rellenos de Camarones. Entrees include such specialties as Arroz con Pollo, Bistec de Palomilla, the very popular Paella from Spain (a seafood mix with Saffron yellow seasoned rice cooked with beer) and ropa vieja (Shredded Beef) a traditional Cuban dish. They have a decent selection of wines, Latin-American cocktails, domestic and imported beers as well as their famous Mojitos. They also have Cuban style sangrias by the glass and by the pitcher.   The design of the dining room is a re-creation of the early 1900's in Havana, Cuba. Although it's not as authentic as it could be, It does create a warm and cozy feel. The chandeliers make the room sort of dimly lit and romantic. There is a lot of Cuban art on the walls and they play Cuban music for background ambiance through the week, with live music and DJ's on the weekends. This seems like the type of place my man Ernie Hemingway would have visited in La Bodeguita del Medio in Havana to get loaded on Mojitos and Daiquiris, then fall into a hammock and scrimshaw a few classics. Ah yes, Big Ern was a wild boy. No doubt. A Piece of Havana features live music every Friday & Saturday from 7PM to 10PM. Fridays are "Havana Nights" with a DJ spinning International music. If you're not too familiar with Cuban cuisine, start with sandwiches and salads and work your way up the menu.

_NRrT4njKaX0q2lVh3RjDA.text: I liked  some things about A Piece of Havana quite a bit. The place is very nice in terms of atmosphere, the garlic shrimp were cooked perfectly, and the wine-broth was very tasty. There were a few hiccups though; while service was friendly, it took a long time to get our lunch and my portion was on the small side. I was actually kind of hungry when I left, which is never a good sign.  Looking at other photos on Yelp it may have just been my entree- so maybe next time I'd opt for rice instead. I also thought the tostones were bland & the green beans next to them were super salty. My best guess is maybe they just salted the green beens twice instead of both of the side dishes? Anyway, I would definitely give them another shot-as overall the main dish did taste good & they have some great sounding cocktails on the menu.

a9yE0R4vAhwWQoJNzqZNzg.text: It seems like a lot of people reviewing this place as not being too great aren't very familiar with Cuban food to begin with. If you are familiar with it and enjoy it, you'll like this place.   I'm native to the Tampa Bay area of Florida so I'm quite familiar with the cuisine. The food here is excellent and seasoned well, the atmosphere is quite beautiful and the staff is personable. I had the Palomilla Sirloin Steak and it was delicious. Their homemade tres leches cake is also intensely delicious (extremely moist yet not mushy), and their Cuban shakes are very good too.

vFVw_Oa3PqYmujIla10IMg.text: Sat down at the bar at 1220... I am now leaving at 1247. I was never acknowledged. Watched as the bartender bussed tables. I will not be returning.

uF9lttBETIxpmOmB_KsCYg.text: Got some coffee and plaintains to go while on a road trip. The coffee was great. Good flavor and hot. The plaintains were not good. I have had much better other places. Next time a road trip brings me this way, I will stop and try the full menu before I write their food off.

Hell, a little salt would have made them better.  Prices were very good.  We got 2 cafe con leches, 1 cafe cubano, order of tostones, and an order of croquettes for $13.

It happened to be kids eat free night and I ordered the items from the kids menu. My discount dining dollar value for a meal at up to $12. I said OK I will order something else. I ordered a meal for $9.95 for the kids to share. I knew that once I presented my discount certificate that the service would be somewhat poor. The waiter never came to check on us. I had to call on another waiter to go and get him when my daughter needed to refill her drink. He never came and asked us if we need anything else. He never asked if we wanted desert or anything but showed up with a box and the check and proceeds to tell me that he only took off 9.95 and not the 12.00. Ridiculous. I tried to protest and he gave me a so sad too bad look. There are just way too many restaurants here in Charlotte for me to give them my business. The food was OK.

F78x4Uj_7H0F8EPWl711Hw.text: The place looks nice and has great customer service. The live band is amazing and plays great music to dance. But, the food is awful to say the least. There is nothing authentic about it. There were 8 of us at the table and no one liked their food. The appetizers were so low on salt that they didn't taste like anything. Our entrees were all cold and taste was horrible. You could tell the food was not fresh and just been reheated upon serving. Honestly, it is a shame that the food is not good as their ambiance and music is amazing. In my opinion the owners should really look into having better quality when it comes to food. Also, although the service from our waiter was good, it did seem they were very pushy all the time asking what else were we going to order when we really wanted to take it slow. Have some appetizers at first and drinks. Then order our entrees, after all a place like this is inviting for you to stay the night consuming and dancing. Yet it seemed like they wanted us served and out. Mind you, we were a party of 8 consuming and there was no waiting line of people wiating to come in. Honestly, I would love to go back only for their music but would definitely not eat here again. I really hope one day they actually serve good authentic Cuban food with quality as this would probably help the business a lot.

The empanada platter is very good (it comes with 4 empanadas and 4 croquettes. I usually get the Crispy beef which is delicious with the chimichurri sauce on top. The churrasco is also very good. _6TkF1_06jaLhQC96nXlgg.text: After a recent visit to FL and enjoying a great Cuban meal there, we decided our craving for Cuban food was worth 30-mile drive to give Piece of Havana a try.  We were not disappointed!  We started the meal with two mojitos, and a pork empanada for me and the soup of the day for my hubby (Ajiaco Cubano for Saturday).  I loved the empanada - it was the perfect portion, it wasn't too greasy, and the pork filling was very flavorful.  My hubby also enjoyed his soup which was full of meat.  For our entrees, I had the fried pork chunks with white rice and plantains.  The rice was nicely flavored (with butter?), the pork was crispy but a tad dry, and the plantains were nicely cooked and not too sweet.  This was a great value for $9.95.  My hubby had the crispy shredded beef with yellow rice and black beans for $10.95.  His rice was just as good as mine, and the beans were well flavored.  We actually preferred each other's entrees, and so we switched halfway through.  His beef was topped with a delicious chimichurri sauce that made the dish for me.  We didn't have room for dessert, but we had to try their Cuban coffee.  Basically, it's sweetened espresso.  They were a tad sweeter than I prefer, but the coffee was good and strong.  Service was fast and efficient.  The dining room is also very nice, and we had a spacious booth for the two of us.  I haven't tried any other Cuban restaurants in CLT yet (really, there aren't many!), but given the great food, prices, and service, we'll definitely make a return trip to PoH very soon!

zSoKOajoOkiieaM98MwWHQ.text: I grew up in South Florida and have a Cuban mom so I know Cuban food. Unfortunately A Piece of Havana does not quite get Cuban food right. I am not saying the food is bad. It is just not Cuban. Other reviews here who claim to be Cuban or from South Florida and give this place rave reviews, I am not sure what Cuban restaurants or food they ate.  Let me give you a few examples. Their Cuban sandwich has mayonnaise in it. Cuban sandwiches do not have mayonnaise in them. They douse their Palomilla steak with Chimichurri sauce. Palomilla steaks do not have Chimichurri sauce. They put soggy onions on their Palomilla steak. Palomilla steak is supposed to have either raw onions or lighly cooked but still crispy onions on it. They put raisins in their Picadillo. I have never ate at any other Cuban restaurant that they put raisins in their Picadillo (although I have been told that some Cubans do cook it this way). And their white rice is completely off. Lacks the flavor or consistency of real Cuban white rice. If you want an example of Cuban/Colombia white rice done properly, head over to Los Paises instead (which BTW is great and truly authentic Colombian food).  To me it seems like they have "Americanized" their meals so it lacks the True Cuban authentic feel and flavor. Again the food is not bad, but it is just not "Cuban" to me.  I have been to A Piece of Havana many times throughout the years. I always go back hoping it improves since unfortunately we don't have many other choices here in Charlotte when it comes to Cuban food, but I always come away disappointed. The service and food quality is also very inconsistent. I can say that some of my meals here have actually been very good and they did get the rice right, but most of the time it is mediocre and the rice is completely off. One time we were seated and had to leave after waiting for 20 minutes when no one even came by to take our drink order.  I also made the mistake of coming here once on a Friday night. They had a live band going and we were seating right next to the band. It was extremely loud and we could not even hold a conversation. As other reviewers pointed out, you don't need a bunch of amplifiers and speakers for such a small space.  Ultimately this place down in South Florida would close pretty soon after it opened as it wouldn't even compare to some of the even more mediocre places. I am not expecting a Versailles or even La Carreta, but would love to see something on the level of a Latin America Cafeteria. Too bad this is not it. Ever since Carlos Cafe closed down, I have not been able to get a decent Cuban meal in Charlotte.

mBdJMCYAARe_AZE5Z1c-pQ.text: The food - my favorite dish, the red snapper is the best.   My only problem is that it's difficult to get a table when you show up, yet you're told they don't take reservations. On several occasions we visited and was told there weren't any available tables because of the tables were reserved, yet there only a few people in the restaurant. I guess my question is, if you arrive at 6:30 and a table is reserved for 8:00, I don't understand why one can't be seated and served and out by the time the table is needed.

The plantains were nice and crispy on the outside, but the yucca was seriously under seasoned. Just kinda a disappointing experience. Not enough to never make me come here again, but it's going to be low on the list of places I want to return to.

The small dance floor was so crowded you can barely move, people bumping into you practically knocking you down because they wanted to take up the whole dance floor. Very disappointed! Won't be back. Need to find somewhere else to go for Latin Music.

9zCWFIxaa-s43kLdYiq_jw.text: I am a Fort Lauderdale transplant that greatly misses diverse foods.  I was stoked to find this place.  I had the Palomilla Steak for lunch and was not disappointed.  The food was well prepared, the atmosphere was very comfortable, and the service was great.  Definitely recommend!!

photos.caption: Photo of A Piece Of Havana - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pallomilla Steak with black beans and rice.  Yum!

xWNZJyvRAsCvjeOQNhkaWA.text: 55 minutes and our appetizers are still no where to be seen. The excuse of, "we are busy" is not acceptable to paying customers. Going to be busy, staff appropriately

VqdBuaiGmaa2vVYvcx-1qw.text: sorry but living In Tampa, Fl. for so long, I got used to GOOD cuban food, this place did not cut, it, was disappointing since it is one of the few cuban places in the area.

w5I9E8u7HgLdmMg_2iLmIQ.text: I ordered the oxtails with rice, beans, and plantains. By far, the best oxtails I've had. Absolutely delicious.

conZSXPFDRQ3Q20EcY9bxg.text: This is the first time eating here. It's a friends birthday dinner and everyone is pretty disappointed with their meals! The steaks were way over cooked. My side- green beans and fried Ukas taste freezer burned. Drinks and atmosphere is all this place has going for it!

Z5XJ6cS0f6mdIZn3BPoWjA.text: My family was double-charged on all three of our checks at the table; so we now have hundreds of dollars pending until the banks withdraw the appropriate amounts. We tried speaking with management who tried to convince us that was procedure. While I know amounts pend until cleared through the bank, it should only be one amount per transaction, not two. The owner called us unreasonable. She then changed her story and blamed her receipt printer malfunction for double-charging three separate checks.   The amounts have not cleared yet and she has finally agreed to a refund, but the issue lies that until the banks open, all that money is still on hold.  I understand that mistakes happen and it was a busy night. We simply wanted things to be made right, not to be fed False excuses. Therefore accept the issue and try to make it right instead of resulting derogatory remarks. The owner has even gone as far as to search for my family members on Facebook, screenshooting pictures to text them to us as a warning to never return.  We had a good time and we were even going to overlook the lackluster food and poor service, but unfortunately this will definitely have us never returning again--even before we were threatened. I even left a $20+ tip because I tried to be understanding. I now regret it. What a shame, I truly believed they were an asset to the community. I would share the texts from the owner and pictures of my bank account, but unfortunately I can't in this review.

nYdSlaTlHi-WejFqnFzY0w.text: Delicious food with a colorful and festive environment. The crispy beef is amazing and their yuca (both fried and boiled) is the perfect side. An authentic and affordable meal with friendly staff.

Yd2YfOXuXfPmeUzezZyFHQ.text: I'm cuban I love their food very authentic when my family comes over from Los angles I always take them to eat here lunch time specials are even better

H_y5LUuDyanWEGDPPoZx5Q.text: Visiting Charlotte for a week, and happened to pass by this place on a Friday night- the live music was intoxicating and my friend and I had to check it out. Food was good... atmosphere was great... and the musicians were playing passionately  add my 2 glasses of Tempranillo and it was beyond lovely. Only thing I wish was that they had more tables available. It was a bit strange to see all the tables in the center of the restaurant completely empty on a Friday night- and to have to leave earlier than we would have liked due to a reservation coming in. (We were still super grateful they sat us for the hour and a half we had there though.)  Really fun dinner experience, will definitely be back next time I'm in town.

uZBsR4JnmxQeOHA9eiowtg.text: This is the second time I try this restaurant  and I'm not going for 3rd is the charm. I tried it a second time in the event the first visit was just a very very bad off day. Today I took guests without mentioning my first experience.  To start the service is horrible and extremely slow. I do not mind waiting if it's worth it and it wasn't.  We order vaca frita, white rice, black beans. Another order was roasted pork with maduros and black beans and another was  chicken with yellow rice and tostones. The white rice was hard, the black beans came straight out if a can and you couldn't tell which was roasted pork or vaca frita. The chimichurrie sauce also didn't have flavor. It wasnt worth the wait  to be served or orders taken and it wasn't even good food or Cuban. My main point for writing this review is so people realize this is Not what cuban food tastes like and I'm disappointed to think many in Charlotte are walking away with this impression.  Save your time, money and taste buds!

RVtZXaUMHUmfMrve8OUuBQ.text: Food was tasty as usual but the service left much to be desired. We arrived around 630 and it took nearly 2 hours for our food to arrive. A couple in group received their food absolutely cold with apology or concerns about that. Makes me skeptical to return here unfortunately

OzFg_rtcexPYKlurP1ibtA.text: Avoid this place!! Horrible service ..Poor management!!!Went there for dinner and drinks on a Friday night at 8pm with a group of friends..Everything was going good until about 1030 when we were approached by an employee who I really have no idea what his function was at this establishment..Not sure if he was a bouncer or part of management..He stated that my party including myself had to leave the premise because they didn't allow shorts after 1130pm..I tried to explain that we were clearly inside the restaurant before that time and that I had just spent a good amount of money at dinner..He stated he didnt care..I asked for a manager and he literally told me I had to leave the restaurant and THEN the manager would come outside!!! When I refused to leave until I spoke with someone of authority he proceeded to now get in my face and tell me " You either leave the good way or the bad way!! OK now I really wasn't leaving until i spoke with the manager!!!! He went outside and got the Police officer who was stationed out front...Out of respect to the officer i went outside and waited till manager came out...I explained that we were not aware of this NO SHORTS rule..It was not posted anywhere..And we just spent a good amount of money in their restautant!!! He said sorry but we couldn't stay..I watched as they literally went table by table and asked people to pay their bills and leave because they also had on shorts!!!!!!Unproffesional all around!! Will never visit this place again..

ss8cFPf12lnFS0RJsZcj7A.text: Recently moved to Steele Creek and found this little place. Took my mother here for her birthday lunch, and I must say I was impressed! The food was delicious, great portions, and great prices!  A waiter noticed my daughter was eating the leftovers of some of my cake and brought me a piece for her on the house!  I definitely recommend, and we will be returning!

0J9S-JtQoRGctk3sZglorg.text: I wanted to really like this place but I've had mixed experiences there.  I went a few years ago for drinks and salsa dancing which was super fun.  We've tried to go back at least twice later in the night on a Saturday to dance again and for whatever strange reason either they were closed or did not have a DJ to do so.    There is very little for a vegetarian to eat on the menu which was disappointing.  A coworker had lunch here recently and it took forever because she said the waiter totally forgot about her :/

gynxIpk35_cdvKnYDa-AWQ.text: We went here in a whim after seeing the movie Chef and getting excited about Cuban food!  It was amazing! We had a lot of dishes between is both vegetarian and fish and Cuban platter!  There was great music, the other patrons were dancing ! A comedian from Venezuela had the mike for awhile which was good if you understood Spanish! Not if you didn't!!  Would I go here again? You bet

DqZ5ahzZkGmda2_5QheVWQ.text: It was my second time here and it was so good! I had the breaded fish stuffed with shrimp and avocado and it's delicious!!!! Also the fried yuca as an appetizer tasted amazing.

kB6NxFKGx1NsFI7cAD_e1g.text: Poor service.there is a star because it wouldnt allow to post without it.but that star is not from me

5EdRufeIwoqZ-P6ZylVzZw.text: Even if you have never had Cuban food before, I am sure you will find something you like on the menu.  Definitely worth trying!  Service:  Excellent.  Ambience:  Nice outdoor seating - don't feel like you are in a strip mall at all.  Inside has plenty of seating, nice decor and a bar.  Food:  Have eaten there several times and tried something new each time - great selection on their menu.  The food is very good.  Nice flavor and cooked correctly.  Portions are good.    Price is fair.

ascm8Lgsv_UTtHuF0gQoHA.text: Was in town finding a new place to call home, and was missing my Spanish cuisine, found this place and I TOTALLY recommend it, the food was almost perfect, the service was spectacular, the place was clean and it felt good to get some authentic Cuban cuisine. If you want delicious Cuban food this place will give you your fix, and I'm from Miami I KNOW what good Cuban food is.

x9zT8ouhIj0DyLPl0XzsqA.text: Last night, my son and I drove from Waxhaw to have dinner at A Piece of Havana.  Being of Cuban decent, it's hard to find Cuban food in Charlotte. The restaurant was fully booked with large parties however, the hosted was extremely helpful and accommodated us knowing that the other parties may have to wait.  We were so grateful.  Her understanding and customer service is a reason I will continue to visit this restaurant and recommend them to others. In addition, we had a fantastic meal, met the most adorable waitress who came from Cuba and has only been in this country for 1 year.  All in all, the experience was fantastic as well as the food.

5wEl4Gsn6W6yCsGUGvGzkQ.text: This place is my favorite Latin restaurant in all of Charlotte!   I've tried all of the dishes, and being Cuban, I've never been disappointed! The mojitos and sangrias are so fresh and well crafted I don't mind indulging in a second glass. Try the Calle Ocho Mojito... it'll make you very happy. And the Churrasco/Skirt Steak with the boiled yuca and plantains is just to die for.   All of the staff is super friendly and they always make me feel like I'm back home.   Definitely should stop by!

qQQuu_n4L1KwQNiNINm74g.text: I was looking for a good mojito and found so much more. Love this place cannot believe I drove past it a million times and didn't know about it. Food,drinks, service it's all super good. If you looking for a flavorful meal that's not your normal boring choices. Check this place out. Mojitos remind me of Miami but bigger

IVBtBy8_W5JDMZGARmIwHA.text: I will never go to this place again!!! My family and I have tried to come here...key word TRIED several times n they are always closed or just closed hours before the time indicated online. They claim they are a family owned business n when business is dead they close early so there for they need to indicate that online.... Needless to say that will be my 3rd n last time trying to eat at this family owned business... Good luck running business like that!

m4aylYOVDTMa9WpgRonV_Q.text: This is my first visit to a Cuban restaurant, but I loved A Piece of Havana.    All of our food was absolutely delicious.  No complaints at all about the service either.  There were several large parties on the week night we were there and from what I could tell, there were only three staff members working the floor and still, our service was great.  The table beside us practically had the waiter explain the entire menu to them, plus the drink menu, and he was so patient and calm with them even though he clearly had his hands full.  I was very impressed.    Is the food authentic?  I haven't a clue - but it was good and that's all I care about.

IwL-IeT73pDOkIpyR8lDMw.text: Wonderful food! Love everything I've ever ordered there. I also love the mojitos, they have several flavors and all are homemade, no pre-mixed crap, always a plus! The service is typically very attentive. The atmosphere is nice and would be a great date spot.

Xg6CExbfE_WgQEqLqDWqaA.text: I have been to this place several times. Time after time I always wonder why I even bother to return. The food is either a hit or miss but the service has always been a miss. It's almost as if you are inconveniencing them to dine there and for that I don't plan on returning anytime in the near future.

y9pL91GBeXWQQnlM_0-s5g.text: Great food and fantastic atmosphere.  The tiramisu is a must.  Service is a little slow for lunch, but it is part of the culture.  Never been here for dinner but the lot has had cars in it when I've driven by.  The ropa vieja and lechon asada are my favorites

a5FLDAbga1XTk2FHwwtw6w.text: I was very disappointed with my meal. I ordered the pork platter and it was so bland, this is not authentic cuban food. Me and my husband spent $30 for horrible food what a waste our hard earned money. I will never go there back again

FgpwPlgH08UzTGdMgq7_Jg.text: I don't know about food but the Mojitos and music are great! We def have a fun time every time we go!

dzE2VRzJwBDycNb909eD6w.text: I've been here a couple of times now..I've gotten the same Cuban sandwich. Awesome both times. Not dry, seasoned right. However, this time I got a drink. No complaints onthe taste of the drink. Actually it sad quite strong with excellent taste, however, I had to go to the bar area to order it. The place wasn't crowded and I arrived after the rest of my party, but I still expected service. They still deserve a 5 star because all else was fine. I just really wanted a drink. :) Customer service regardless for what needs extra attention..

7XarHHnP21Alqe4xTh1PqQ.text: A Piece of Havana is the kind of restaurant you'd drive past a thousand times and never think to stop.  Then, one day you do and you never stop coming back.    Located in the way back of a shopping center, you think it's going to be some shlubby fast food dive (not the good kind).  It isn't.  The inside of the restaurant is almost opulent with deep leather booths and romantic curtains over massive windows.    And then there's the food.  I had the empanadas, Cuban sandwich and my boyfriend had the roasted chicken.  All were outstanding!  In addition, my boyfriend had the Cuban salad.  It had at least an entire avocado sliced along the rim.  It was delicious.  I'm so glad we went and we will keep going back.  Next time, I'm getting the oxtail.

aFeqMb9wAsq1OLHa3KmBKg.text: The food was outstanding and authentic. And Friday there is dancing. A real gem.  The roasted chicken was excellent the lentil great and empanadas are not to be missed.  The plantains were great too. We will definitely come back here every time we are in the area. Because I have to take my wife there or she will kill me. :-)

w9YCN3dqETCXXmR-226soQ.text: Great place. Went for lunch the other day for the first time and was very impressed with the portion, price and quality of food. The dining area is open and has a good feel, the decor is nice and the waitstaff was attentive. I will go back for sure.   Lunch - $5.95? roughly, included meat of choice and 2 sides. Well worth it. This truly is a hidden gem, if you have driven by it and wondered about it do yourself a favor and check it out.
